I knew that going in b/c of the reviews but bought it anyway so my next trip I will bring a spare with me. I got the purple one so it would stand out in my bag and be easy to find. Don't get it if you dont like purple b/c it is PURPLE. I like the fact that the flash pops up but my finger got in the way the first few days until I started to remember to not put my finger in that spot. Overall, the camera is easy to operate, takes great photos and I highly recommend it for point and shoots.

Reviews.Title: Gr8 value for the buck
Reviews.Author: Devaki N. Sharma "Dev Sharma"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 3 weeks back and i am very impressed. The pics are as good as my DSLR and the zoom with image stabilization is very good performance wise. DIGIC 4 processor is quick like a T1i. I live in Seattle and have used this camera for long shots of the olympia mountains(50 miles) and Seattle downtown from my apartment in Bellevue which is about 25 miles away and i have seen the crispness and zoom quality to now recommend this camera.Also shot a lot of pics indorrs in low light and outdoors when i visited Tulip town last week. Everybody who has looked at the pics could not differentiate if these were from my DSLR or the powershot SX210IS.There are some design features like the flash being where our left hand would hold the camera and the need to keep your left hand off it when you power up. Otherwise Canon's got a winner here....Great pics with superb zoom and stabilization done right. Very Strongly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Everything is great except ...
Reviews.Author: Ivo
Reviews.Content: Well it is great choice and I am very happy with my camera, but few things set clouds over my happiness:Here it is:Cons:Very easy gets dust inside lenses, always use with care, protect and try not shoot when windy.Very easy loses focus when filming.No international coverage of the warranty.In video mode zooming and wind can be heard in the clip. Do not zoom often in quite environment.Almost useless flash, possible it is the worst thing in the camera, it makes handling difficult and when in use under artificial lightning it sets wrong white balance (pictures are yellowish), very short range.Pros:Outstanding good pictures in good light conditions.Great focusing and zoom capabilities.Compact and easy to use (except handling, caused by the pop up flash).Very fast start and ready to shoot.Overall experience is good, but looking for way to get the dust out of the lenses if someone can advise me how (currently abroad).

Reviews.Title: The greatest purchase I've ever made
Reviews.Author: C. King "Sea King"
Reviews.Content: I have been buying Canon cameras since their first digital fell on the market. I love them, I admit it. I've tried others, they don't compare. That being said, they have never been amazing in low light and they waited their sweet time to put out a pocket sized camera with a usable zoom. I've been holding off buying one for 3 years just so Canon could get their poo together. I was getting mad, how could Sony, Olympia, etc. have streamlined, pocket-sized, 5X zoom, OK in lowlight, easy to use, market ready cameras years ago and Canon - who, with Nikon, is really the only camera maker worth paying for - be so far behind? Now I understand. They waited because, as Woody says in Toy Story, they weren't aiming for the truck. This camera blows every other camera I have ever had out of the water. Not only did they laugh at 5X zoom and give us 14X OPTICAL with 14 MP, which is unheard of, but it's almost impossible to take a bad picture. I'm still messing with the options and figuring out how to use some of the settings, but honestly, putting it on Auto or Portrait and just 'pointing and shooting' got me some amazing shots, even at night - phenomenal shots. THIS CAMERA IS EASY TO USE! The only thing I had trouble with is taking pictures of a drummer on stage, which, if you have ever tried to photograph concerts, you know is pretty much an impossible task in general - crazy low light, distance and lots of movement. There's a little bit of noise in low light shots, but the color is wonderful and the ease of use is unbeatable. I'm even in love with the flash as it doesn't drown out the color or background like most do if it's just too dark and you need to use it.I have 2 complaints, and they're legitimate ones.1: Battery. There's no way to turn off the display to save it, the life is pretty short, and the batteries are expensive. But that being said, for every day use, get 1 extra and you're probably fine. I took mine on vacation, charged one at night and used the other during the day. Battery life is about 2-3 hours straight use, but if you turn it on and off for a few shots throughout the day, you're fine. I have 3 in total, just in case.2: Flash pops up automatically when you press the power button and it's right where you comfortably hold the camera for use. I have a feeling I will be wrecking that motor. Seems like an oversight to me, but as you can manually close and open the flash, hopefully I'm not killing it every time I accidentally hold it down - I guess that's TBD.FYI standard underwater houses do not work for this camera because of the lens length (even without hitting the zoom), and night shots get trickier when the battery life is low.The video is not true HD (its 720p) but as I bought it for photos, not HD recording, I look at 720p as icing on the cake, and the sound quality is not bad at all - I filmed a song in a rather loud concert hall, and it came out pretty well - plus you can zoom during recording, which is great (you'd that that would be an obvious thing, but not all cameras let you).Almost no red eye issues thanks to the pop up flash - in fact, my blue eyes looked rather dynamic in almost every shot, and the flash is perfect for standardizing pictures with too much background light. AND, the thing is pretty sturdy. Hate to say it, but it's been dropped, yet doesn't even have a scratch.This camera is so wonderful, I'm thinking of selling my Canon PowerShot SX1IS.Now buy it already!

Reviews.Title: for $199, can't beat this! Nice pics in dark @ ISO 400. MADE IN JAPAN!!!
Reviews.Author: woome2
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera. MADE IN JAPAN. Feels nice with aluminum body, not cheap plasticy.  Pictures in restaurant at ISO 200 & 400 (without using flash) turns out very nice, provided the subjects stay still for the shot.  I bought this at $199 on a sale here, and I'm loving it.

Reviews.Title: Cannon SX210IS
Reviews.Author: jimmy mac
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions after one month of ownership.This camera was purchased to replace an SLR film camera which required manual adjustments of zoom, shutter speed and apeture settings with a fast 1.2 50 mm lense and a 2.8 200 mm lense.One of the most difficult aspects to overcome for me was the requirement to look at a screen rather than through the lens at the image being shot. I found this difficult for two reasons. The first reason is that the level of detail on the screen is just not as good as the image through the lens. The second reason has to do with factors such as glare, brightness and contrast, and a slight amount of far sightedness making it somewhat difficult to adjust focus from a distant object to the screened image. However, I found that with a little patience and practice the images shot with the new Cannon SX210IS came out well centered and the autofocus did a credible job of obtaining details. This is no doubt due to the great combination of the zoom and the 14.1 MP images. The patience and practice came in handy during my grandson's soccer games, trips to playgounds when photos of both grandkids were taken and during the Thanksgiving holidays when friends and family dropped by. One slightly negative note regarding the flash capacity at ten or more feet should not be considered a deterrent to purchase of this camera; but, should be a factor to consider when preparing to take a shot. I know from research and reading that there are ways to overcome some of the lighting issues with settings internal to the camera. However, I have not taken the time to reset them and experiment with them yet.This camera was also used to take video shots of a few moments duration and the imaging was very nice and stutter free. The microphone is a little on the tinny sounding side in my opinion and not quite as good as a purpose built video camera. However, for a small format camera that easily fits in your shirt pocket it is much less cumbersome and less intrusive as was noted during my granddaughter's Thanksgiving recital.In addition to the camera, I procured a very nice 16 GB class 10 sdhc memory card good for hours of video or hundreds of photos. I highly recommend this size card and the class 10 speed to make the most of the camera's capabilities. I also purchased an extra canon OEM battery which I have not even needed to use as the battery life of this camera has been very nice.I have had photos processed at local photo kiosks on up to 8 by 10 sizes and used similar and smaller sized printed photos on our home printer and been very happy with the output.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX210IS
Reviews.Author: jlg
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, however, one's left hand can very easily be in the way of the flash as it will automatically rise when the camera is turned on.  The telephotic aspect is exceptionally good.  The on/off button is too small and can be difficult to push.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: A. McGuire
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It takes beautiful pictures about as well as an SLR camera! The only downfall, is the high amount of megapixels make the videos harder to download. Not a big problem and its worth it for the beautiful pictures!

Reviews.Title: Zoom Zoom Zoom
Reviews.Author: Skoobdo
Reviews.Content: I didn't purchase my SX210IS from Amazon, but got it from Newegg because I kept waiting for the price to go down from the $299.00 price that Amazon had it set at for a couple of weeks, and then raised it back up.  Anyway, Newegg had it for $299.00, with bing cash back and they threw in a digital key chain.  I've only had the camera now for a few days, but I'm so amazed at how nice it looks and performs.  I read many reviews on camera websites, and all the reviews here, and out of all the other Canon cameras to choose from this was the best one for me.  I shoot lots and lots of Landscape Photos, and many at a great distance, and definitely need a good Zoom, which this camera DOES have.  I wanted also, a camera that would take HD Video with zooming in/out functions.  It does a great job in taking video and photos.  I've read about folks that don't like the flash popping up by their left finger, and I just don't have that problem because I never hold cameras with my finger on the left top, probably because I take a lot of pictures with one hand :-) while driving on the road.  But, I'm sure after you accidently have your finger there and the flash pops up, it won't take long to know not to put it there.  It's just a non-issue with me. I also read some reviews about when you're in photo mode you only see the image through a portion of the LCD screen and that black bars are on both sides.  Well, I noticed that too, until I changed my settings to "wide screen", which is the type of photos I prefer.  So, the screen displays the entire image, including when you take videos.  There is nothing that I've found that I don't like.  The number one thing I like, is the fact it fits perfectly in my back jean pocket.  I did order an extra battery, case, 8GB memory card, and another extra charger with A 12 volt adapter for my vehicle from Amazon.  I'm a happy camper!

Reviews.Title: I like the zoom and the portability.
Reviews.Author: A. Lee
Reviews.Content: I haven't had the chance to really put the camera through its paces yet, but so far, things seem pretty good.When I was looking at it in the stores, I was worried about the little toggle for adjusting the zoom... It seemed too small and finnicky and not so easy to control... a bit uncomfortable, too, since it was angled and hard, but I can live with it.I don't mind the flash popping up.  I usually am holding the camera in the area and it keeps the flash down easily.The LCD screen is a nice size.I was shooting some indoor shots in low light.  The automatic settings--auto, night, indoors--all seemed to over-expose the shots--which was worrying, but I switched to manual (the controls were fairly intuitive, so I didn't have to keep referring to the manual), and could take shots without a tripod. As long as I can get shots fairly easily, I don't mind.  But for those wishing for better auto shots in low light, I guess they are correct in complaining, or at least noting the problems.My expectations aren't high... I just needed a new camera to replace one I've had for five or six years--so just about anything new would be better for me!  I wanted this one because I hadn't tried a Canon before and everyone was always raving about them (I'd had Olympuses), and I liked the super-zoom in a small point and shoot.  The size and weight is convenient.  The color is cute, too.  I think it will work for me as a fun little camera that is capable of a bit more (especially regarding the zoom) than the average digital camera.

Reviews.Title: OK camera but the LCD and fiddly controls ruin it for me
Reviews.Author: Jim "Just Jim"
Reviews.Content: The LCD is not as vibrant and detailed as it should be at this price. It looks pale, grainy, and washed-out even in normal room light. The resolution is disappointing and that makes it difficult to use the LCD when evaluating the effect of different settings in the field. I found the lower dial to be very touchy and its being unlabeled just makes using it even more annoying. I find this dial to be very touchy and that does not suit my large hands. The flash always deploying at power-up is a distraction and an annoying gimmick. I seldom use flash, so it is particularly irksome for me. I had higher hopes for this camera and its high zoom range and presumably decent performance. For me, there are better cameras at this price point. This camera may suit you just fine only you can tell. For me, though, I am returning the camera for the issues I've cited.

Reviews.Title: A hard decision between SX210 and ZS7
Reviews.Author: Deal Hunting Cow "MCT"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get a camcorder for our newborn. After many researches and testing of 2 other camcorder in $300 price range(Sanyo VPC-FH1A, Panasonic SDR-H100) I've decided to get a travel zoom type camera with good photo and video quality. And as long as photo is descent, I was mainly interested in better video quality.SX210+Pro+longer zoom+Bright Viewable video in low light with only 2candle on a table.+Excellent user control and menu and spinning control switch, I loved the menu and control.+I would say about 20% longer battery life than the panasonic with its GPS off.+Manual focus option+Better flash light exposure/light handling+No motor noise during zooming in video.-Con-Soft/fuzzy lens. Not sure if unit I got was defective or all of them are alike, it is 1of2 main reason for not keeping Canon. General users won't realize this unless you do a side by side comparison with a sharper image.-High noise video. Even in bright indoor lighting condition. The 2nd main reason for not keeping Canon-The weird...or lack of ergonomic design, which one can get used to with practice. Hard to operate with one hand.-Sound recording is lacking, when replayed on my pc, sound felt distend and tinny.-Highlights pink/magenta color.-Its got great flash exposure, produces nice looks flash photos, but in auto mode, it would lean to use longer exposure/higher ISO over flash...no idea why...ZS7+Pro+Beautiful video, the video is over processed, but video looks great.+Sharp lens, takes sharp photos and videos+Wider angle, and the i-zoom is very usable.+Great sound recording quality, what you hear is almost what you record.+Ergonomically friendly to handle with one or both hands.+When in full auto modeCon-Image is over processed...I really don't like it...look too unnatural to me, Even customization to tune everything down in setup does not help much. However, most general users will find the image beautiful, but that's because some of the details are gone, and colors are adjusted. A image taken of my wife with ZS7 will show her with smooth skin with light makeup, but when taken with SX210, you'll see the reality of wrinkles and no makeup. However same would apply if you want to take image to show detail...there will be no detail of fine scratches/fine dusts/fine particles...-Video taken with 2 candles, and background music in the room to emulate cake cutting, was very dark. However, if you can adjust the brightness and contrast on the player you use, you'll still be able to see most things that was captured by Canon. So the data is still captured...just too dark to be viewable.....wish this was adjustable in camera.-The menu control is not as innovative and easy to navigate as the Canon, is not bad, but can really see some improvement.-In auto mode, it leans towards using flashes....which does not offer as good as exposure when compared to Canon.In the end I kept the Panasonic and returned the Canon. It was a hard decision for me until I realized the fuzzy image Canon was producing, because I simply can't stand a fuzzy video or image. My wife is happy with the wrinkle removing feature...and I will revert to my DSLR if I wanted to take photos of greater detail. You will not notices the fuzzy images unless you pixel peep at 100%, it really doesn't matter to most users who print at 4x5. But I can tell the Panasonic have a very nice lens.I'm a Canon fan, but in this line up, Panasonic did a great job.

Reviews.Title: A little disappointed
Reviews.Author: Justina Scamporlina "j. scamporlina"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to have a compact point-and-shoot that would fit in my purse, the zoom and pixels are fantastic for this size of camera, I wanted to like it more. I love Canon's products but this one doesn't seem to fit the bill. The focus is slow and if you're trying to be quick (like you need to be with kids and pets) 1/2 the photos turn out blurry. The features are nice. The location of the flash is very annoying. The video is great as well as the audio. I can't decide if I'll be keeping it yet but I recommend going to a store and testing the camera before buying.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.  Easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something to replace my Powershot SD600 which has finally started having problems after being a great point and shoot for over 6 years.  The SX210IS was easy to use right out of the box and takes GREAT pictures, even for someone who doesn't use all of the features.  I had thought that the (lack of) view-finder would be difficult for me, but I guess that the occasional use of cell phone cameras has moved me into the way of the future, because that is not a problem.The automatic pop-up flash took a little while to get used to, but for a novice photographer, I acutuall find the ability to (gently)close the flash without going through the menu a plus - choosing to take shots without the auto flash was never really considered before, but now I get the chance to play with that.Very satisfied with the camera!

Reviews.Title: The Best Christmas Present!
Reviews.Author: Julia A. Andrews
Reviews.Content: First, I would like to thank my Amazon electronics guru, PC Junkie, for his input on this camera.  Wonderful research and review!Secondly, I realize it is only the first of October but this camera is the best Christmas present from my husband.  It was time for a serious upgrade (camera, not husband)and I didn't want to make a serious mistake as this is for the long haul (camera and husband).  I have used a Canon Powershot point and shoot for several years, in fact, technology had left me in the dust. I definitely did not want a SLR, I wanted something that I could use at a moment's notice. I want pictures of my husband, family and friends, my cats, my garden when the hydragenas and roses are in full bloom. I am not doing a magazine layout for Vogue. This camera description was just perfect for my list of wants and needs.  Having used friends' Elphs I was not impressed with the tiny bits as they were just too awkward for my mature fingers.  I verified this was not a problem after I did a test run in a camera store. I almost fainted at the camera store price as it was MUCH higher than Amazon.  The next day I had a message from my Amazon Cart informing me there was a fifty doller drop on the Amazon camera price.  It was kismet!Thirdly, one of the best features about Canon is that you can use their cameras right out of the box, which I did with this one.  Ease of use, set on Automatic, zoom in or out, click and download.  I have used only a few features on this camera and find the picture quality AMAZING!  Amazing ZOOM feature! I waited for the right one to come along and I am not sorry to have done so (husband and camera).  The auto setting takes motion without blurring esp. nice in a high pixel point and shoot.I did purchase two products to complement this camera (also researched and reviewed by PC Junkie) that I highly recommend:Transcend 8 GB Class 6 SDHC Flash Memory Card TS8GSDHC6Deluxe Leather Case PSC-3200 (for SX210IS, also compatible for S90)Enjoy the pics!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot & MAC Smooth Operation!
Reviews.Author: Zamo "Flamerose"
Reviews.Content: For those MAC lovers, this camera works very well iPHOTO. I've had it about a week and have been taking photos at school of my students and the photos are so crisp and clear. We're planning a trip to Italy this summer and I wanted a camera that could do it all and be compact.  I like the advantage of being able to recharge the battery. I have another Canon digital but it uses AA batteries and drains quickly. This model will work well.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but focus problem in video mode
Reviews.Author: C. Kirk
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera wanting a small point & shoot that I could carry with me to take videos & photos of my kids.  I have a camcorder (Sony HDR-CX500V) for home.  I really wanted to like this camera, it has everything I wanted in a camera.  I ended up having to return it though due to video mode.  Videos were often going in & out of focus and the exposure would change for what seemed to be no reason. Outside did not seem to be too bad but at home it was awful. I tested the video mode in the exact same low light & low movement situation with other cameras that I already own (older Canon SD1000 & Canon S2IS that only do VGA video) & the video was actually worse due to the focus problems.  Maybe I received a defective unit?  I really purchased this mainly for video, the zoom, & size factor so after finding out the video did not work for me, I didn't really check out it's photo capabilities. I did not have any immediate problems with any other aspect of the camera including the placement of the flash.  I realize at this price & for this size of camera everything will not be perfect but I really wanted the videos to be better than my older cameras.

Reviews.Title: better cameras are out there
Reviews.Author: The Mariners Fan "Eriko"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to "upgrade" from my Canon sd 780is. What my main priority was a camera with HD video capability, low light photos, and the quickness in which i can take photos. Unfortunately, for this camera it only excelled in the video category. It takes great HD video and the speaker quality is great as well, but the video quality wasn't that much better than my old Sd 780 (if at all). While video recording it tended to focus in and out often which was very frustrating. It was a pleasant addition to have the opportunity to be able to have manual controls on a digital camera since i'm a die hard SLR fan. The megazoom was really great, and fun to play with. But that is where the positives end with me.The camera quality sucks, the photos came out pale and washed out, even soft looking (indoors and outdoors). I tried playing with the settings and I could get better shots, but for those quick shots, it fails. FYI: it will NOT catch anything that is moving, trying to catch up with my 2 yr old goddaughter was near impossible. I got better photos from my 2 year old Canon SD 870. The flash is terrible: it's terribly placed and its frankly annoying to have to push it down when i don't want an overbearing flash to flood my photos. It is a larger camera, fairly heavy, and my hands are small so I found myself holding it in an awkward position and fidgiting often to find a comfortable position to take photos. While the screen is large, I found that the photos always looked grainy.This camera is perfect on paper, it has all the specs to be a great camera. But the quality of it just isn't any better than Canon's older digital cameras which simply doesn't justify the price. I'd go grab the Canon S95 instead.

Reviews.Title: Keep it Clean
Reviews.Author: sierrajoe
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for a few months now.  It's got some nice features but one issue that really bugs me.The good:*  Great Zoom*  Great pictures*  Great 720P video, even while zooming*  Lots of control options.  It's not a DSLR but probably the next best thing for control.The not so great:*  Flash is right where you want to hold the camera*  Microphones are right where you want to hold the camera.*  If you're narrating, the audio seems to vary a lot.*  Autofocus is pretty slow if you're using the camera for video.*  Not sure if image stabilization works for video, but if so, it does not work well*  Zoom motor noise is obvious in videos.The bad (IMHO):*  This camera is not dust proof / resistant and dust gets into the optics really easily.  It would be one thing if it were easy to clean but, it's impossible as far as I can tell.  So, once it happens you're stuck with sparkles in every shot that has sunlight coming in from the side, lighting up those dust specs.It's a shame that a couple o-rings weren't thrown into the design to make it more "pocketable".joe

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT. Best camera I've ever had.
Reviews.Author: Adam Nasser
Reviews.Content: This camera has AMAZING resolution, zoom, and video capability for a camera its size. I've read reviews saying that the flash location is annoying, but I've had no problems whatsoever. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Picture clarity superior to Sony
Reviews.Author: farmerclint
Reviews.Content: Don't think that the pop flash is just old technology.  It is actually an easy way to turn flash on or off without going through menus and making a selection.  A great idea.  After owning 3 Sony Cybershot cameras before switching to Canon for this one, I'm very pleased with this camera.  What other small camera has a 14x zoom for under $200?  The color quality and lighting correction are better than I have ever seen on Sony digital cameras.  It is also amazing to me that they would make such a great camera with such a humble look.The ability to zoom when recording makes a big difference.  My only problem with the camera is that the auto focus sometimes doesn't totally work until the shutter button is halfway pressed for a second.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful, wonderful product
Reviews.Author: screaminnocence
Reviews.Content: Very simply put, I'm technologically challenged. I can work my cell phone and do a few tricks on the computer, but when it comes to cameras, I'm about as knowledgable as a great-grandmother with dementia. All I know is to push the shutter button and smile.I love this camera. Tired of the typical Walmart $100 buys, I splurged and recieved a piece of machinery that makes even my pictures look fantastic. Listen to no one else; this is the best camera you can get for $250.

Reviews.Title: Great package in a portable size!
Reviews.Author: Bobette Rife "bobette27"
Reviews.Content: We have had a Canon Rebel EOS for about ten years (with additional lenses), and have been really happy with it.  The only probem?  It is a large camera that has to be hauled around in a bag, and this isn't convenient for many times when you want to throw something in your pocket or purse.  So we needed something smaller and lighter for those uses, and when you want to hand it off to a waiter or a bystander for a quick shot.  We have been happily surprised with the quality of most of the pictures we have taken.  I find myself taking a lot more pictures because this little baby is so convenient!  Our larger camera has 16 pixel quality photos (which is still better for taking portraits, etc.), but, our new Canon Powershot has 14 pixels...such an improvement over those older models...I am in love!

Reviews.Title: I'm really pleased
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Mounce "Doug Mounce"
Reviews.Content: I wanted the perfect combination between point-and-shoot and a full-blown SLR.  This camera is a little heavier than I expected, and I'm always nervous about moving parts like the motorized retractable lens, but the optical zoom gives me exactly what I wanted to determine wide angle versus 50mm shots without losing resolution.  The manual features that allow you to set the shutter speed or the aperture or both is exactly what I wanted.  There are a number of automated settings (portraits, landscape, indoor) that look useful, but there's no documentation to say what the settings are or how they are determined.  This camera will be a favorite friend over many years if it lasts that long.  I think I'll be able to get exactly what I want in a quick shot when I get used to the camera settings for different lightings.  It also allows you to set the ISO, but I haven't researched how these words from the old days of film translate to a photon collector.  What I remember about my old SLR was that with 400 ISO film I could set the shutter to 1/125 or 1/60 and get a pretty decent photo in low light without blur if I kept steady.  We'll see how it works with this one.  You can also do tricks like setting the aperture really small and giving a long exposure for something like a sunset, and that way you get the depth of field as well as bring out the red wavelengths if you're on a tripod.  Haven't tried the movie yet, but with a 16GB memory it says I can do an hour of video.  I don't expect wonders from the micro tho.  Haven't tested the batter life.  All in all, I'm really pleased.

Reviews.Title: still figuring it out
Reviews.Author: ash
Reviews.Content: I can't say I've looked too in depth into the manual, but I did have quite a time trying to set the settings on the manual mode. I can't blame the equipment yet because I'm not extremely familiar with the terms. I didn't give it a full 5 stars because one of the reasons I got this camera was for the supposed excellent indoor photo quality. while yes, it does take really good photos when its all indoor lighting, the quality change is pretty drastic if there is any amount of natural light involved as well. I tried playing with indoor and outdoor modes for this and it seems pretty difficult to find a medium. Perhaps someone with more experience would be able to figure it out more but as someone who purposely chose a point and shoot over an SLR for ease, it's a little disappointing. I read some complaints about the bottom right corner being darkened because of a "lense shadow" in indoor closeups, I haven't had any problem with that. Overalla very nice camera, excellent photos when zooming far in, just have a steady hand when taking them.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Rperalt
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great and the size and weight are perfect. I wanted a camera small enough to carry around in my purse but that also created great quality pictures and that is exactly what I found in this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great all-around camera
Reviews.Author: David Annecharico "worship nut"
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research before purchasing the SX210. For the price, it had all the features I wanted and then some. The big bonus; it fits in your pocket! I had just returned an Olympus SP-800 14mp 30x zoom camera which shot great outdoor nature scenes but did a terrible job with indoors and basic family photos. The SX210 does it all. The 14x zoom is plenty for 99% of what most us will need. I shoot everything at 14mp so I can get the extra zoom by simply cropping tighter. Smile detection is a lot of fun to use. Video is not bad and the software that comes with the camera even has pretty good editing capabilities. I purchased an extended warranty because of the poorly placed flash that pops up when you turn it on. Just about everyone that picks it up has their index finger right on the flash and you hear a click as the camera tries to open the flash. I'm told by Canon technical support that they do it all the time also but have yet to break the flash on any of their cameras. Apart from this one flaw I'd have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Feature rich camera
Reviews.Author: Var
Reviews.Content: This is my second camera after a very long time...I was expecting a good replacement but got an excellent one. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: shadow cast when flash is used
Reviews.Author: E. Au "queen b"
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera yesterday, and I LOVED it the moment I opened the box! It looks amazing, and the color is very attractive. The size doesn't bother me at all. There are tons of features on this camera that I still have yet to learn about, if I want to learn about them at all.I was taking photos and I realized that there was a shadow at the bottom right-hand corner of each photograph. I thought maybe my hand was in the way? So I put it on a flat surface and turned the self timer on. NOPE! The shadow was still in the way... I decided that I would turn off the flash, and there was no more shadow. so I guess the awkward flash really has something to do with picture quality? I cannot use a camera that leaves a shadow for every picture I use flash with. I am definitely going to return this, even though I was extremely excited for the release about two months in advance..

Reviews.Title: Amazing Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a study abroad trip to Ireland this fall. To test the merit of the camera I went to the Giants v. Jets game at New Meadowlands Stadium. Sitting in the second teir using the zoom I was able to get crystal clear, beatuiful shots of the action. The video is clear and sharp but the microphone is suseptable to wind, but this was not so bad that it took away from the overall performance.Overall this is an amazing camera with great picture quality, zoom, and battery life. It is still small enough to fit easily in a pocket.

Reviews.Title: No HDMI cable
Reviews.Author: C. Laska
Reviews.Content: Just got the camera, and so far so good. nice quality photos and innovative features. But it reacts a little slower than I hoped for - my 7 year old Sony is about the same speed - albeit 1/3 the mega pixels.  But I'm a little disapointed that a camera touting HDMI output requires me to get cable separately (they include an analog style red/white/yellow cable like what you used with a VCR) So I will have to wait for the accessory cable to arrive to see how my photos and videos look on the 50" plasma. I skipped the canon brand $40 HDMI and ordered a $4 no name brand. Keep in mind this is mini hdmi to hdmi. I jut feel that for the price $329 they could include the cable that takes advantage of HD video and HDMI output offered on this model.BTW my charger is a nice compact unit with a built in plug - nice to avoid yet another charger cable.

Reviews.Title: Videos won't play with Windows Media Player
Reviews.Author: ColombianGandhi
Reviews.Content: With the newest release of PowerShot models Canon has changed the recording format of the videos from Motion-JPEG based.AVI files to Quicktime.MOV files. According to them this was done to reduce the file size and improve the quality of the videos.You can use the ZoomBrowser software to convert the files to other format types and save them:It takes about 15 to 60 minutes to convert the videos, but I only need to convert the videos that I am e-mailing to friends that don't know about QuickTime.1.  Select the images.2.  Click [Export].  The [Export] menu appears.3.  Click [Export Video].  The settings window appears.4.  Specify desired settings. For detailed information, click the [?] button and refer to the Help displayed.5.  Click [Finish].  The processing window appears and the settings areexecuted.Using the ZoomBrowser software that was provided with the camera you cancreate original movies by linking movie clips and still images.  You caneven add titles and other text, background music and various specialeffects.  To do this, open the ZoomBrowser software and select [Edit]and [Edit Movie], then follow the steps outlined in the software.

Reviews.Title: New camera is very satisfactory!
Reviews.Author: Michael O. Shipley
Reviews.Content: The camera is as expected. That means that it is better than others I considered. I highly recommend this camera despite a higher price.

Reviews.Title: Still Loving it
Reviews.Author: Robert Bredlie
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a couple of weeks now and am still loving it. The image quality is great in both bright and low-light conditions.When I first bought the camera I was experiencing the slow performance that many people have mentioned here.  That problem disappeared when I got a newer memory card.  The original memory card was one that I have had for years.  It has become my backup-backup memory card now.  With the new card I was able to consistently take pictures of flying snowballs during a snowball fight in my neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: Its slow
Reviews.Author: K. patel "Zerry74"
Reviews.Content: Movie quality is good.Two things didn't like:1. Very slow processing, it takes even longer after capturing movies.2. Can not keep camera steady, will have to learn where to and how to adjust my left hand on camera!

Reviews.Title: This camera is to slow to be considered a camera!
Reviews.Author: hsk15k "hsk15k"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice features/settings, excellent image quality, Bright LCD, Lightweight/Portable, Simple controls/menu, easy to useCons: slowThis camera is to slow to be considered a camera - a sketch pad might be faster. There doesn't seem to be a buffer and the save time to the memory card is agonizing slow. This camera would never be able to handle sports or children playing - you'd miss too many shots. It's too bad because it has a lot of nice features in a small package. As a reference my G7 shoots twice as fast and its an older camera. Faster memory cards don't seem to help much. I shot with a Class 4 and a Class 6 - no noticeable change.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished
Reviews.Author: Jean
Reviews.Content: the camera is not the problem. When you buy this camera with amazon.com, and the SELLER IS AMAZON.COM, they will send you the refurbished one, with the package UNsealed. that is what they sent me.It is NOT written anywhere that it is new. and, it is not new at all. BUT, when I openned the unsealed box, everything was like new. I got screwed, mainly because when I order CD's, and the seller is : amazon.com and notan independant seller that sell through amazon.com, they used to sell the SEALED CD. Then I thought that this camera will be NEW AND SEALED. Oh Boy, I was so wrong.GOOD LUCK AMAZON TO SELL MORE IN THE FUTURE. I HOPE THIS TEXT WILL BE BACKED UP. It is 100% the truth.

Reviews.Title: Get the S95 instead, picture quality not as good as expected
Reviews.Author: PieInTheSkie
Reviews.Content: I bought this and the canon s95.  I am a long time Canon owner, having owned the Sd750 for several years and having loved it.  Mind you this review is from someone who uses the camera on Auto in Point-and-shoot mode only.  The SX210IS simply did not measure up.  While zoom is fantastic, pictures came out blurry and night/low light pictures were same as my old SD750.  On the other hand, the S95 looked incredible in both day time and especially at night.  I figured its more common to take pictures in the evening or night than to need 14x zoom, so I opted to keep the S95 instead.  Also the video of the SX210is was surprisingly grainy.  I took videos of the same scene with the SX210is and the S95 and my old camera.  While the SX210is was marginally better than my old camera, the S95 blew them both away.One last thing, the flash placement is quite irritating.  It was hard to hold the camera.  While people may get used to it over time, forget about handing the SX210is to other people.  No one could hold the camera right!  The S95 has a pop-up flash as well, but there is space for your finger at least.

Reviews.Title: Quirky auto lens cap. Where's the flash?
Reviews.Author: holypants
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, I bought and returned this item within a week.My previous camera was the Powershot SX200 IS. It was stolen out of my car, so I went for a slight upgrade. I figured 210 has to be better than 200, right? And cheaper. More mega pixels. Bigger zoom. Score...Or not.First off... for a point and click camera, it really expects you to trust the automatic features. For instance, try turning the flash on or off. 3 minutes of menu-hunting, people. The SX200 has a nifty little button right on the back (on, off, auto toggle).From day 1, the auto lens cap on the 210 didn't open entirely, leaving a black vignette on all my photos. I had to remember to push it open with my finger, smudging the lens half the time in the process.The LCD is a joke. It's set to widescreen (I suppose for videos), but because of that it adds black sidebars to your photo previews. This makes the 3" LCD virtually 2". It's a camera, not a video camera. The screen should take preferance to still photos and make them larger. Put the black bars on the video!I'm returning it and getting another SX200 IS before they go completely out of stock. It was a wonderful camera (although slighty bigger/heavier), and I suggest you skip the 210 and do the same.

Reviews.Title: Worst Canon I Have Owned
Reviews.Author: Dolf M
Reviews.Content: I have owned nothing but Canon digital cameras since the 1MP days... All of them have been great. Except this one. I remember how much I loved the A95 that I had right before this...The performance is awful. Very slow. Slow focus. Slow shutter. Slow!The quality of the photos are very inconsistent. Yellow tinges. Flash too powerful. Flash too weak...The only good things I can say about it is the size is great and it looks cool.Overall, a major disappointment...

Reviews.Title: Excellent 2nd camera
Reviews.Author: michrony
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a backup for DSLR. First, I want a small camera to make additional pictures to choose from. This includes both full-scale pictures and visual comments/captions. Second, I need a simple alternative for a telephoto zoom. Finally, I have no use for a full-scale camcorder, but appreciate reasonably good HD video.For all these purposes SX210IS works fine. Nothing can replace F1.4/50 lens, but I find this small camera quite capable to compete with DSLR equipped with a cheap kit lens. This is exactly what I need! Also, I find the flash excellent, I don't think image color quality it provides is much worse than that of external DSLR flash.Considering the fast progress in point-and-shoots, IMO, it is better to spend about $200 and use the camera for a couple of years than invest $400 and find it outdated pretty soon. This camera is just right in this respect as well.As I found out, it makes sense to get a couple of extra batteries, they can be found for $3 apiece.

Reviews.Title: Above average pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Jen "Jen"
Reviews.Content: This is not the smallest or lightest pocket camera you will find, but it has a couple of features that make it stand out from the rest, especially for traveling. First: the zoom. It's a 14x optical zoom. Not a 3x optical plus a useless "digital" multiplier. It's going to be tough to hold it steady enough at 14x to get sharp photos in all but the brightest conditions, but that's why they make tripods. With this lens you can zoom in on high-up building details or that strange bird across the marsh. I also use it to get photos of far-off signs I want to read.  The other feature - and one I rarely see on cameras in this category - is a Manual setting for aperture and exposure. I admit that under normal conditions I usually leave it on P, or Av or Tv. But once in a while I want to do something the camera doesn't recommend and blur out running water or get a smaller depth of field or something like that.  The M setting is why I bought this camera.I just got back from a trip to Yosemite and I was really happy with the shots I made with it. There is a bit more noise than with my DSLR but nothing terrible. Obviously, this won't replace a high-quality SLR under all conditions, but sometimes you really don't want the bulk. I haven't really used it with the flash but I assume it's about as useless as on most P&S; cameras.I'm giving it five stars because of how well it works for me.  But I do want to mention two little downsides: First, there's no viewfinder so for composing you have to use the screen. In bright light, this suffers the usual visibility problems. Second, the battery life is not very good. If you do a lot of in-camera review and deletions, the battery may not even last for one full day of shooting. I bought two extra (Canon brand) batteries and go out with at least one fully-charged spare on me. I have had to use my spare. Fortunately, the charger is fairly compact and easy to pack, so with a little organization you can easily charge up overnight and stay on top of batteries on a trip.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Everyday Camera
Reviews.Author: Lisa Hillstrom
Reviews.Content: We recently purchased this camera based on a friend's recommendation and the reviews we read on Amazon.  We were leaving for a trip and needed a camera fast.  We couldn't be happier with this one!  It took pictures in multiple types of weather, in daylight and at night and every picture turned out great.  It zooms well too!  It does use a lot of memory to make a video, so be sure to get a SD card of 4 or 8 KB.

Reviews.Title: soso
Reviews.Author: ss
Reviews.Content: the only reason i don't like the video is because:1. it glitches2. videos are Quicktime onlyother than that it's ok..i'm kind of disappointed because i bought this camera for a concert that i've been trying to go and it failed me.i'm a little upset.

Reviews.Title: Blurry - Slow shutter! Great for night shots!
Reviews.Author: MommyGee
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for almost a year now. I was impressed with the quality of the pictures. I am selling stuff on craigslist and ebay and I've received emails not about the items I'm selling but what camera I'm using. It is great for macro and night shots. Which is one of the things I've considered when buying since it has high rating when it comes night shots without flash..The negative side of it is, the speed. Very slow shutter and taking pictures of my 1yr old boy and 2yr old girl is very frustrating. It comes out blurred most of the time!!! Even when using the children/pet setting. My 6yr old Kodak takes better picture when it comes to moving objects. I don't recommend it for parents whose main purpose is to take pictures of their children who moves a lot and runs around. There's a great lag in shutter, even if I turn "review" off. Another negative is, when using flash, pictures came out to be super bright even in distance and it just washed out the picture. It also has kind of very orange tint on it.If the main purpose for using the camera is for nature, still pictures, then go for it. Great quality! I have a couple of sunset photos over Manhattan Skyline and ppl thought its from a DSLR..

Reviews.Title: So Much Camera for the Money!
Reviews.Author: S. Calderon
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after a trip to Alaska. I lugged a heavier Canon Rebel, which I did like , but after carrying all the equipment and lenses that I needed I decided life was just too short. I was constantly banging my camera and equipment into objects and people. Life on ship can be crowded.This little camera has been the answer to just about everything I needed in the way of a camera. It is light enough to carry anywhere, a big plus. I am very pleased with the video part, excellent quality. The sound could be a little better, but it is minor. There is so much packed into this little camera. If you like playing with all the manual features, like the SLR, they are there. I am still a beginner when it comes to all the different things like arpeture, etc. and that is what makes it fun for me. All these features are here as with my SLR but I can learn as I go with this camera and not feel like I need a degree in Photography just to get though the camera guide.I recommend this camera to anyone who likes a light weight camera with a excellent zoom and great pixels.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Kathy Leckinger
Reviews.Content: Overall, the camera is very good and has many very nice features. When I purchased it, I really thought that it would be much more compact in size. It is quite large compared with many other point and shoot digital cameras with similar features. I actually had problems finding a case that would fit it properly....they were either too small or too large. Even though I like it, I'm not sure that I would repurchase this item.

Reviews.Title: Optical Zoom is great, Camera not as great as s95, better than 1400IS
Reviews.Author: zhanup
Reviews.Content: Bought this for $199 on thanksgiving. I really wanted a camera with large optical zoom, but still keeping it compact. This camera is perfect for my needs. The optical zooming while video recording is what made me choose this over the more expensive s95 (which was $299 on thanksgiving).The manual features are up to the mark, the sensor is not as strong as s95, (low light photography without flash requires an ISO setting of 800 for non-blurred pictures while same would be possible at ISO of 200/400 on s95). The grip of the camera is perfect, I wasn't very fascinated by the zoom joystick at first, but you get used to it! The dial to switch the modes is a little tighter than what it needs to be. Flash quality is excellent, it's only the mechanics of the flash that scares me a little bit. You can force it to open close manually and it also opens/closes mechanically at power on (if your finger is not covering the flash, it will open) and power off.The screen is also excellent. Mic quality is awesome for videos (including the stereo effect). I am not sure if there is an option for reducing the wind disturbance, but at first glance I couldn't see it! One little flaw that I noticed was that, while shooting movies in a quiet room with zooming, you can actually hear the lens movements in the video.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly great video!
Reviews.Author: Stephen A. Carter
Reviews.Content: So I purchased this camera for my wife since our first child was born a couple months ago and we needed a way to start capturing memories. This camera does the job... that is for sure. The first thing I noticed about the camera was that it takes amazing video. In fact the video is better than my mothers video camera she received last year. The only down side about the video is that it saves without any compression making the file sizes huge, but since I can compress the video myself using 'Any Video Converter' (which is free) I have no issues.The photos come out really nice with the flash. Even in light settings, it seems that when the flash is on the camera takes better photos. With good lighting it takes surprisingly sharp photos. I say that it is surprising because you don't need to keep your hand perfectly steady all the time. It definitely is built with some good algorithms for face finding and focus.The only down side to the camera was the blurr affect of moving objects. I was disappointed with the fact that some of my pictures were coming out blurry but then found that compared to all the other cameras that my friends and family received for christmas, my camera was blurry far less often than the others. Some of the other cameras were even priced higher than my SX210IS and could not produce a single crisp image. I would say that as long as the object in front of me is moving at a fast pace, the SX210IS outperforms its competition. We are very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, not the greatest low-light
Reviews.Author: guave78
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong by the title, this camera is amazing! The image quality is great, my only complaint is the low-light performance (it's not horrible, I'm just very picky. Which is why I gave it only 4 stars); but that is a downfall that almost every compact camera I've had has (minus my old Canon S100 Digital Elph, which still beats my newer Sony DSC-S650 & Nikon L11 compacts for overall image quality). My wife uses the camera all the time and loves the smile/wink feature (she loves self-shots, and this allows her to hold the camera steady and not have to push the button to take a photo). I love the manual control that this camera allows you to have, I feel it comes in second only to having a digital SLR.I would recommend the SX210is to anyone who is looking for a great, easy-to-use, compact camera.

Reviews.Title: The BEST camera I have every owned!
Reviews.Author: trush
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my grandmother about 6 months ago (to replace her 35mm) and did a ton of research before doing so.  It is such a fabulous camera, I just bought one for myself.When I first purchased it and was "testing" it, I took pictures of the angel on top of our tree from about a 100 feet away.  The camera will soom in to 56X, but the picture was not a great quality.  I could zoom in on the angels face to about 36X and have a good picture.  I have had it for about a week now and have taken about 250 pictures and the battery is still showing fully charges.  (The one negative about the battery is that it is larger than the old canons, so you can't use old batteries as a backup)  I tried taking a picture in a pitch black room (I could not see my hand 2" in front of my face).  The picture came out so perfectly bright, you would not have been able to tell I wasn't standing in a brightly lit room!!  I also took pictures with the sun right behind the people, this camera balanced it out and took a perfect picture!I have always been loyal to canon and this is the reason why!!  This is the best camera I have ever used!

Reviews.Title: The best mid-priced digital camera I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: Rebecca J. Nagy "MT in SA"
Reviews.Content: I seldom write reviews, either something has to be a complete ripoff, or it has to knock my socks off!  I have to say, this camera has blown me away!  I have owned this camera for about a month.  Last weekend I took it to an NBA game in which we had nosebleed seats, literally about 15 rows from the rafters.  I was skeptical about the zoom function, but I was thrilled to see just how well the function works.  We were taking photos of the players and the zoom was so efficient, we were able to get inside the team huddles.  My adult kids have given my camera the nickname of "Stalker".  This camera is by far the best of any digital camera I have owned and trust me, I have owned several.  I can't wait to take it to the beach next summer to see what it can really do, given conditions such as sunlight and sunsets.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Larry J. Parkhurst "mik Parkhurst"
Reviews.Content: Reviewed a lot of point and shoot cameras before selecting this one.Pros:  Takes great pictures and has a great zoom for a such a little camera.  And, it's  good in low light.Cons:  This is not a great action camera...not fast and a little fuzzy.  Have to get used to holding it without covering the flash.  Just have to get used to it.Overall:Very easy to operate and takes very good pictures.  I have a NikonD5000 which is fantastic for action shots and takes great pictures but, it doesn't fit in my pocket like this one does.  I'm really happy with it.  It does what a little camera should do really well and is very cute.  i got the purple which shows the print on it better than the gold.

Reviews.Title: Good universal camera
Reviews.Author: M. Duong
Reviews.Content: Overall it's a good camera with decent photo quality and HD video with excellent zooming capability.  The photo quality is very good outdoor with plenty of light; but it is not so good indoor or at night. Photos of people indoor with flash on, taken in different settings including the auto mode, are just OK even when standing in front of them. Even ethough it's good enought for 4x6 photo prints, any zooming in when viewing the photos will show grainy deatails.  The 14x zooming is awesome. However, distance objects taken when zooming in all the way are not very sharp, again, when zooming in during review.  HD video is very good, and zooming during taking video is excellent.  The assignment of one touche button for capturing video is a very convenient feature; one don't have to turn the dial back and forth between taking photos and video.In the end, I returned it and pay a little more for the Canon S95.  I'm happy with the decision.  Even though the zooming is not as good (only 3X) and can not be change while taking video, but the photo quality is exellent, day or night.

Reviews.Title: My Powershot
Reviews.Author: Mukthiar Gani "Gani"
Reviews.Content: This camera has delivered all the features and performance as advertised.I totally love it.Looks good, feels good.Picture quality is excellent and has performed well in adverse weather conditions.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: marcly
Reviews.Content: Excellent Canon camera. Thin, light but powerful. Photo quality is amazing. However, the only problem is (probably I can setup the options but I cannot find) the flashlight always pop up every time I power on the camera, which can be a little annoying for me since I usually don't use flashlight.

Reviews.Title: Easy operation . .Great photos
Reviews.Author: Donald Darmogray
Reviews.Content: Wanted a simple easy digital .. Great viewing screen . . Easy operation . .Have recomeneded to friends

Reviews.Title: Great filling
Reviews.Author: general
Reviews.Content: Excellent little camera. I was thinking of purchasing a digital SLR but this camera will do everything I want without the bulk. Photo quality is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Great cmaera, but clumsy
Reviews.Author: Raymond D. Leroy "rleroy"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. The quality of the photos and the features are perfect for us. Our only complaint is that using it is clumsy because of the flash and how it is positioned. It wasn't distracting enough to return the camera and we are hoping we can get used to it. It makes it hard to hold steady for those special shot.

Reviews.Title: Great 14x Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Ingalls
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after much research,just before making a trip overseas, so I had less than a week to use to it before I left. Great camera, was easy to use and I love the 14x zoom. I was able to get excellent pics and video while sightseeing around Prague. I had very good low light pics, in several indoor situations. Even preferred the ones without the flash!! As they had great color and captured the settings better in several unique restaurants that had some mood lighting. Highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awsome
Reviews.Author: BigJ
Reviews.Content: The image stabilization is great. Video playback on 55inch tv is awsome.Easy to use in automatic mode.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: R. B. TOMLINSON
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small, portable camera with a lot of features.  I am certainly not disappointed in this camera.  I like the powerful zoom which gives me a lot of flexibility in taking various shots.  The focus is very good, and the controls are easy to use and understand.  Very enjoyable and easy to slip into a pant or shirt pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great features and pics
Reviews.Author: Lizzy Lizard "Liz"
Reviews.Content: I am having a bit of trouble getting the focus I want in the macro mode, but am getting better at it.  The pictures are great, clear, crisp and I love all the features such as single color, sepia, etc.  Nice compact size and easy to see screen.

Reviews.Title: Love the Cannon
Reviews.Author: G. Holmes "Taking care of the house"
Reviews.Content: It has great zoom and great picture quality. Sometimes the extended zoom and focus makes it a little slow but the pictures you do capture are great....

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot SX210IS
Reviews.Author: Apt Manager
Reviews.Content: My old PowerShot died and it was time to try to get a camera that would take pictures of the grandkids at their school functions and graduations and at concerts we go to. The 14X Zoom is awesome compared to the old 3X zoom. Somehow instead of a blurry dark picture I can actually recognize the kids, it's a pretty good picture for me, a point and shoot type guy. I do need to go over the user manual for a couple of things when I have time. The on/off button is tricky even for my wife, I like the Zoom button, and the single button for showing card photos I just took is excellent. The dark shots turn out as well as my old Olympus Digital camera with it's larger lens. Did I say the 14X zoom is really nice, works well and better than the last PowerShot. I don't usually use the digital zoom but tried it out and got some usable pics of birds and plants etc. so that I could recognize them, they were pixalated, but much, much better than the old camera. I haven't figured out how to play the movies yet. I take it everywhere and take pictures of whatever interests me even if it does take a minute to get ready, I also drive my friends crazy. I probably take about 5,000 shots a year. Many blurry, and missing the kids that were there 2 seconds ago. I thought about a digital SLR but this is just too convenient.

Reviews.Title: very good camera
Reviews.Author: Shopper
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera. Lots of features and light weight. It's worth for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: R. Hardy
Reviews.Content: Hi.  I think this is a great camera and am glad I bought it.  Got it on Black Friday 2010 on Amazon for $200, which was a heck of a deal.If you are looking to make a decision, here are some observations that may be helpful.I have been a photo enthusiast for 20 years.  My main camera is a Nikon D40 with lenses ranging from 17 - 200mm.  Have owned Canon compacts for over 10 years.The camera design has one interesting design aspect.  The flash always wants to pop open and it's a smidge awkward to hold, but I am getting used to it.  On the other hand, pushing it back down is a positive switch when you know you don't want the flash.The 28mm is wide enough for me.  The magic is on the long end. Most cameras go to maybe 135mm.  400 is a huge difference.  With the digital zoom on top of that, it's around 800mm which is ridiculous.  I hike and camp a lot, so the 28mm is good for sunsets, etc.  On the long end, I can get shots of shy birds, or shots of things I want to remember but don't want to get so close to - like bears and cougars.  True story.This is marketed by Canon at a semi-advanced user, and one does get shutter, aperature, and full manual controls if you want to use them.  Program mode works very well.  Put it in Auto mode and hand it to someone to take pictures of you when you are out and about.I set mine to "Vivid" just because I like the saturated look.Probably the best feature is the command dial on the back.  You can fine tune the exposure on the fly up and down by two stops if you are taking a picture of a high contrast situation and the meter doesn't give you what you are looking for.  That's critical to me.Having the capability to take video up to HD quality is a bonus.  Low light photography is also quite good.It can also overlay a composition grid and do a quick zoom on the focus area to ensure what you want is in focus.It's not a 'party camera' you can slide in your pocket like the SD1400.  This thing has a BIG lens barrel.This is a 'travel' camera.  It's not big by any stretch, but pocketable in a jacket.  Very good picture quality with a long lens.So in the final analysis, I love my Nikon D40 and use it a lot when I am feeling artistic or have a special occasion and want to carry it around.  This camera is fantastically capable, and I keep it with me all the time.  Canon will eventually redesign the flash location.  It's not a deal breaker for me, though some reviewers have a strong opinion on that one.It's not a DSLR in terms of image quality or speed.  But it's 90% of what I could ask for as a hobbyist. This could replace my D40 if I didn't just enjoy using a DSLR.All in all, it's a great camera.  I am glad I bought it, would buy it again, and would recommend to a friend.Cheers,R

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Miller
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this camera from an SD790 from canon.. I also own a rebel xt. If you like ease of use and the really cool features like color accent, and color swap....this is awesome . The zoom on this thing is also incredible. We do lots of watersports, so being able to zoom rather than risk getting the camera wet is great for us. Also the video from it is incredible, though it does require a well lighted area to prevent graininess. All in all, it is the best camera I have owned yet. I am a die hard canon fan and once again very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Best Point and Shoot I have Ever Purchased.
Reviews.Author: Tj
Reviews.Content: This is the best P&S; camera I have ever purchased. There is little positive I can add that has not already been said, so I will only list my otherwise minor gripes about an otherwise great product.Most armatures (like me) will find themselves using the AUTO feature quite often, at least until they are confident enough with the more specialized settings, and for the most part it is a great feature. One aspect I like is the ability to focus the AUTO setting to adjust based on the area of the scene that is most important. Such as center, surroundings, and full scene. However if you intend to take a lot of quick shots, it takes a few seconds to 'prep' the shot before it is perfect, which might be irritating... This is also the case when taking video. If you make rapid changes in distance and lighting, the few seconds of blur can be irritating.Another thing is the speed with which the camera actually takes the pictures. Mine seems to pause about 3 seconds between every snap while I hold down the button. And this is even with preview disabled. Reducing the picture resolution doesn't seem to have any effect either. Perhaps a faster SD card might help, but they get very expensive past the 15Mb/s rating. I wish there was a way to speed this up.Lastly, the microphone. It is stereo, which is nice, but it seems to dull the higher ranges and is very easy to accidentally cover up with your fingers while taking long videos.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: Lobsang
Reviews.Content: This camera is just excellent.  The other review pretty much said it all.  For the money the picture quality, HD video(stereo) and incredible zoom are an unbeatable combination.  The camera is built solid like a tank.  For around 350 dollars you cannot do better I would say after looking around.  It is great in low light as well and can be run full manual.  The position of the flash at first sems strange but after you get uesed to it it actually is not bad at all.  You can simply close it if you want to and leave the flash on. I strongly recommend this camera.  It really produces excellent pictures under many different conditions and that is the bottom line..

Reviews.Title: Good camera, only if you know what you're getting
Reviews.Author: Joe W.
Reviews.Content: This review is my personal opinion. I bought this camera elsewhere, but Amazon is still perfectly safe. The SX210IS has a wide screen LCD.  This is great is you like to take a lot of movies.  If not, the screen is just too big for the pictures that it takes. I bought it mistakenly thinking that it could take shots in the same shape as a print, that is 4 by 6. But this camera does not do that. It takes 4:3 shots and 16:9 shots (as in standard and wide screen TVs).  Most folks will want 4:3 and for this, the screen is too wide.  The camera has what reviewers call "heft."  I call it heavy.  Too heavy for my shirt pocket.  On the plus side, it takes very decent pictures and has a number of settings usually found on SLRs, such as Aperture and Speed priorities. In short, if you want a mini-SLR and you don't mind the default 4:3, than this camera will work great.  On the other hand, if you want a second camera, one to just throw in your purse or carry in your pocket, then look for something lighter.

Reviews.Title: canon power shot 101s  review
Reviews.Author: lee schwartz
Reviews.Content: great little camera that takes very nice images and color.  neat little devices like taking pics with subject wink or when teeth show.  cannot for the life of me figure out how to send images on a mac.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Thomas "Mac Addict"
Reviews.Content: Best digital camera on the market. Great zoom and high quality photos. Easy to use and upload. Very high quality.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: This was my first digital camera that my mom got me for my birthday over 2 years ago. It's a great camera for everyday use and takes excellent pictures. I love the purple/magenta color that makes my camera very distinctive and easy to recognize. This camera has a very good zoom. Takes okay night photos.

Reviews.Title: I like it !
Reviews.Author: A.H.
Reviews.Content: I have Canon PowerShot almost 2 years, easy to use and work good. I am very enjoy it ! :D

Reviews.Title: Very good!
Reviews.Author: Andres
Reviews.Content: Great camera!. I took a nice photos on my vacations and I enjoy it always with my family. The camera coming with a good package and everything ok. Excelent zoom and resolution!

Reviews.Title: Very good brand at a very low cost
Reviews.Author: Raymondcr "Raymondcr"
Reviews.Content: This is a great gift not expensive, very good brand and reliable. Canon is a great product cant complain. Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: hi
Reviews.Author: seri07
Reviews.Content: Hi. Thank you very much for such products. I am very pleased with this purchase :) It is very practical and very efficient. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: I love my purple camera!
Reviews.Author: Thrifty shopper "Andi"
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed using my camera for several years!  I know I still have not used all of the features!  It takes great close ups as well as telephoto shots!  Good movies also!  I would recommend to all novice camera users!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera-- packs a powerful punch!
Reviews.Author: Lindsey
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! Being in the broadcast television industry, I needed something that has excellent quality, that wont take me ages to set up to take a shot. This camera was the answer. And it is possible to get that professional-looking, "blurry background effect." For close up shots, such as flowers, the camera automatically goes into macro-mode and will auto-focus on the subject. If you want the effect on a person- stand at least 25 feet away from your subject, and fully zoom in on them. I found this works by keeping the camera in "auto" mode. Also, this makes excellent HD videos as well! I saw the band Berlin in concert recently after I purchased the camera, and was able zoom in on Terry Nunn singing. When I could hold the camera still enough, the video *almost looked professional-quality. Highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Good Picture Camera, Poor Video Camera
Reviews.Author: Julian Chang "Peaceful Warrior"
Reviews.Content: Item received before expected.  Item was as expected in Used conditions, but it was hardly Used.  I would say box was opened and closed and then, they sold it.  I am very happy with this camera, very nice and clear shots.  There is only on minor detail.  Whenever I am shooting a video the lens tends to go Off focus a lot.  So expect a movie with clear and blurry parts.

Reviews.Title: Hit or Miss
Reviews.Author: JMI372
Reviews.Content: I have had Canon cameras for over 25 years. I bought this one after my A620 quit working, which was a fantastic point and shoot camera. I have had this camera for over a year. The pictures are either a hit or miss (totally out of focus even though you let the camera auto focus) and I find myself taking multiple pictures at one time hoping one turns out. It is very slow to respond and having strangers take pictures is totally hopeless. I do not like the quality of indoor photographs, outdoors are very nice. Children and pet setting is worthless, auto is much better. One positive is that I do like the big LED screen.

Reviews.Title: Great- till it stopped working!
Reviews.Author: gail
Reviews.Content: Loved this, except it suddenly stopped working: would turn itself off without warning after just a few moments.  Sent it back to Canon for 'in warranty' repair.  We will see.  If it worked it would be a five star, for ease of use and great pictures.  Only, if you want really fast response time, you have to go to a real SLR-  so action shots and fast changing facial expressions- not so much.  Everything else, great, and it is a great carry-everywhere camera

Reviews.Title: Focus Issues
Reviews.Author: Kerry
Reviews.Content: I have had several digital cameras, most small Canon's and I bought this one for the zoom.  It is great.  Unfortunately a problem I experience with this camera is that about half of my pictures are not in focus.  It is very sensitive to the setting and often just will not focus.

Reviews.Title: I still don't have a camera from Canon that works
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Let me start this story by saying that in the past, I have always loved Canon.  I've gotten multiple Powershots over the last decade and been really happy with all of them.  So October 2010, I thought I would spend the extra money ($320 versus the average Powershot ~$200) to get one with a better lens.  And THAT was a HUGE mistake.I started noticing problems with the focus halfway through December (convenient - I have virtually no photos of the holidays that year that aren't blurry).  After deciding that I couldn't do anything else to fix the problem, I spent $25 to send it in at the beginning of January 2011.  They apologized, said it was defective, and fixed it for free.Fantastic.Then in May, my lens was having problems retracting.  So I spent another $25 to send it in again.  This time they charged me $150 to replace the lens.  I had a big vacation coming up so fine - I paid the money.  I got the camera back.Then in August, I start noticing problems with the focus again.  So I write Canon, begging, saying that I simply can't do this anymore.  I'm coming up on my one-year warranty, I've already sent it in once, paid an additional $200 for it, I'm over it, I want a new camera.  They were gracious enough to send me a shipping label and said to make a note that I am requesting a replacement.  So I did that.  And THAT'S where my respect for Canon as a company ended.I sent my camera back in.  I got an estimate for $130.  To which I called them in a fury saying absolutely not, that I could not possibly put more money into a camera that simply wasn't worth it.  They apologized, saying it should be free.  Fine.  So a week later, I check on the status of my camera online - nothing.  So I call them - AGAIN.  Apparently it was shipped across the country without my knowledge, the process is delayed by a full week, and they can't make any comments on my account until it lands at the new facility.  Fine.  So I wait another week.  I have to call again (keep in mind that I'm on the phone with them for 30-60 minutes Every. Single. Time.).  They say that they have no idea why it was shipped to another facility, nor why it's taking so long.  So they refer me to a customer service rep who takes 3 days to call me back.  I miss her call (dammit!) and now haven't been able to get in touch with her despite calling her yesterday and today.  I've also informed them that I'm leaving for vacation in 5 days and would like to actually be document the experience.  Look where that's getting me.For those of you keeping track, I've now spent $300 on the camera, $50 in shipping and $150 on a lens for a grand total of $500.  For a whole lot of stress, a lot of time on hold, and very few pictures from the last year of my life.The fact that they keep "fixing" this camera and it fails two months later gives me total lack of confidence both in this model and the manufacturer.  I'm not sure if it's a defect within this model (as I've always loved the Powershot and I've heard great things about their DSLRs), or if it's just this particular one that I have.  But save yourself the trouble.  Buy a NIkon.

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I was tired of carrying my larger camera around.  I'm still experimenting with it.  I need to get used to holding a smaller camera still but I'm super happy with it.  The zoom is great, photo quality is great, and it's easy to take it along with me everywhere and the small recharchable battery is wonderful. Keeps its charge for a long time and no more carrying around spare bulky ones.  Now I never miss a photo op because I didn't feel like carrying a big camera along.If I could change anything it would be the location of the flash.  It's right where you place your finger to hold the camera.  However that is easily fixed by moving your finger.I'm very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE EVERYTHING BUT THE HAND CRAMP AND DESIGN
Reviews.Author: nienie
Reviews.Content: I own the gold and I really like the features that are on the camera.  I do however have some concerns regarding the design of the actual camera.Everyone has discussed the "flash" misplacement.  Terrible place for a flash however you can push it down and raise it up manually after the first turn on so I can deal with that.I have short stubby fingers and holding the camera with ease is a little difficult.  There are no grips and it is a slippery camera to try to hold one handed without some type of curvature. My hand actually cramps up from holding it.  The toggle switch used to zoom in and out is very tiny and I wish canon left it old style  on the shutter button.The lcd is nice but I don't understand why they took away viewing for the entire screen for a picture leaving the sides blank.
