You will however save yourself a lot of money purchasing one with a rechargeable battery vs battery operated only cameras so if your thinking about the price think of the $10 plus dollars for lithium or double AA's you stuff in the other cameras and if you use them a lot like I do you will be running to the store frequently.I LOVE all the IDEAS of this camera and so many features but design is "killing" it -and me.  Would I buy it again "YES"  I am just hoping they can make a silicone sleeve for it!  "lol"Construction is good everything feels like a camera should without that cheap plastic crap they have been making camera's out of that feel more like a kid toy than something you paid good money for.Now one more point.  They made an updated version of this camera already.  GPS sucks up the battery.  It has less megapixals. And what was wrong with this one that they changed some major items?  (sx230 hs)Here's to hopefully some rubber gripping.  BTW --Great pics and video.

Reviews.Title: Good camera...need one change
Reviews.Author: Gradsnap
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for those that want a compact camera but need full control over the their shots. Only one thing I don't like about this is the shutter button. It is flush with the top of the camera and has a very light touch and feedback. It is hard to tell when you are pressing to focus or when you are releasing the shutter. I found myself inadvertently taking photos before I was ready. The button needs to be firmer so you know positively when you are focusing and when you are actually snapping the picture. I'm getting used to it but it is much, much lighter touch than my Nikon compact cameras. On the other hand, image stabilization is excellent at high zoom and picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Money! =D
Reviews.Author: Chama
Reviews.Content: I bought this after owning a Canon PowerShot SD1300 IS Digital ELPH 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Pink). That was cheaper and I loved the image quality but I was a bit disappointed with the zooming available. Before that, I've used Kodak, Fuji and an Olympus digital cameras but they weren't as satisfactory.This camera is great!!! I loved the picture quality, and the 14x zoom! I could zoom and take photos of people further away in a really good quality compared with all of the previous cameras I've owned! It has a pretty good focus, automatic + manual functions and all in all... though I'm not a professional photographer, my photos have come out pretty good. I spent way less money on this camera, to get good quality photos and since the camera is small and light, I won't need to carry around those heavy, bulky professional cameras either! Very very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Excelent Price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Excelent Price, fast Shipping.Easy mode to take Automatic, Manual, Landscape, Pets and Object in motion, Multi focus, 720 HD Video, etc... And all those easy things that every photographer must have to get going in order to learn.this camera, i mean, isnt the Most professional Cannon Camera Ever. Instead of, is the perfect Crossover between Begginers to Serious Amateur Photofan.EXCELENTE OPCION PARA COMPRAR (Spanish)Greetings from Caracas Venezuela

Reviews.Title: A great camera for the size and price!!!
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: I was debating on getting a regular pocket size camera or a big DSL camera and ended up with this one. I took it on vacation to the jungle and was able to zoom in and take pictures of animals and birds at the very top of the canonpy tree-line. I love this camera and have recommended it to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX210IS Camera
Reviews.Author: WilliamT
Reviews.Content: This a a great general digital camera.Pro's:Price, size, functionality, spec's...Con's:You need to remember the flash which rises up on the LHS of the camera you you would normally hold it with your left hand when you want to take a pic. Once you are use to that then it is ok, but can be annoying in the beginning. Believe the later models have sorted that out, but I cannot confirm that.Suggest if you are interested in this model you visit a dealer and check it out so you are aware of the flash issue, althoough you can lift or push down the flash manually as well.Overall without making a mountain out of the flash position you get a great little camera for a good price.Pixels, zoom capability, manual and auto functions for the price look no further.

Reviews.Title: Pretty dang decent...
Reviews.Author: John, The Beloved "PS"
Reviews.Content: It is truly amazing to see what Canon can pack into a relatively compact point and shoot these days.  I've had 3 other p/s canon's and wore them all out in extreme outdoor adventures. The SX210IS may be the mighty mouse of them all. More features than any normal quick shooter will ever use but worth reading about all the possibilities when that magic photo moment presents itself and you're brave enough and educated enough to adventure beyond the Auto and Easy settings. I really like the ability to manually and instantly flip the flash up or off to instantly compare a special lighting effect. Could use a more detailed manual. Should come with an 8 mem card. Amazon for an extra battery. For this price you get truly exceptional features which if this little rascal holds up over time equals value and, that for me seals the deal.

Reviews.Title: Good quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Edan Aharony
Reviews.Content: The camera produces good pictures. But the shutter leg is way too long and when you take videos the focus is slow to react so if you move the camera from one spot to another the picture becomes blurry until the focus adjusts which I find very annoying and I find myself not taking anymore videos because of that, it's that obvious. The pop up flash on the side of the camera is a design flow because it's exactly where you tend to put your fingers when you hold the camera, and you'll find yourself closing the flash again and again without noticing. Edan Aharony.

Reviews.Title: Little digital SLR
Reviews.Author: Afour
Reviews.Content: Used this camera while on vacation, not knowing the outcome. It did a Quality job, that I would expect from my larger SLR. You will not go wrong with this one. The price was also an excellent one.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: laurar4
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I chose it because of the enormous zoom and the HD video recording. There are many useful and fun features to keep life interesting. The only thing that could be better is the flash which is a pop-up arrangement. It's no big deal but if it was just inbuilt and not another moving part it would be better. In all other respect though it is well worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous camera
Reviews.Author: SFMom
Reviews.Content: The zoom on this camera is amazing!  Takes great pictures.  Less red eye problems compared to older Canon Powershot cameras.  A little bit difficult getting to the menus for Beach, Aquarium etc. especially since it isn't written in the manual.  Otherwise, very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointing
Reviews.Author: Abby
Reviews.Content: I really liked this camera on paper... but time has proven me wrong.The flash is amazing (though poorly located). it is by far the best feature of this camera... never noticed any shadows as other reviewers tell.what bothers me the most is that half of the pictures I take at night are useless!!! THIS CAMERA CAN'T FOCUS in poor light environments! I hate this! I gave it plenty of chances. Always the same. And if I ask somebody else, who's not acquainted with this issue, to take pictures, I would bet I'll have to delete at least 80% of them.Also the camera is slow... even if you are pressing the shutter half way.I've had sony, panasonic and even canon before. I've always complained on the weakness of the flash. Now that I have a potent flash, the rest of the camera is useless.Oh... and Why oh why can't I choose the image quality on widescreen mode?!?! Who still shoots in 4:3 ???? unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Looks at Books
Reviews.Content: We had an earlier SX210 that has worked well, so, when the time came for me to upgrade, I wanted to try this model for its wide-angle lens and its impressive zoom. I knew about the annoying pop-up flash, which is still annoying, and in this version the on/off button is harder to deal with than the earlier one. But I can deal with design issues; what I hate is poor image quality. Even without zooming, many of my photos were blurry, not sharp. That could arise from the camera being lightweight, or the image stabilization perhaps (which made it hard to estimate when the shutter would fire). The color resolution was not good, with extreme contrasts and little color saturation. Yes, perhaps I hit the wrong adjustments, but I don't think so and did not do so deliberately.  I don't adjust a point-and-shoot much; I want something that works out of the box. I tried to adjust the photos with basic software, but the colors and bad focus made almost all of my photos dull to look at and uninteresting to try to adjust. I figure that, even with decently rated models, there are some individual items that are kind of lemons, and I think this was one. Others may wish to spend time trying to adjust the exposure, but I'm sending it back.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Canon!
Reviews.Author: Marianne C. Rafferty "womanoperator.org"
Reviews.Content: I love love love the photos I have taken so far. The low light are fantastic, and the zoom is incredible. The only con I can see is where the flash has been placed as my finger is always there when I start it up. Its going to be just a matter of getting used to holding it differently.Almost over a year later and I still love this camera even more than my rebelsIt's over 2 years old and still works well and delivers great photos even in low light.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've had so far!!!
Reviews.Author: Priscila L. Thomas
Reviews.Content: I really liked this camera. It is the best camera I've had so far. Its awesome zoom let's me take great pictures.I was gonna buy Kodak Easyshare Zoom 26x, but after doing some research and talking to a photographer he told me I should go for Canon or Sony.I can say I am very satisfied with this camera!!!Pros: great zoom, very good video quality, 14megapixels takes very good pictures, light weight, not AA battery, I bought an extra battery though so I can take lots of pictures.Cons: flash is not very fast, not very good for pictures in movement, like sports.I love Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great functioning camera
Reviews.Author: Chris Sippel
Reviews.Content: The Good:Very good quality images in the daylight, although the 14 mega-pixels is a little unnecessary.Flash is very easy to toggle on/off(just open or close it) Some people complain that the camera is awkward to hold because of the flash placement but i personally like where it is.The menu system is extremely easy to use, very nice for changing settingsThe camera itself is very easy to use.14X zoom.It has fully manual controls (zoom, aperture, shutter speed).More than enough special picture modes to play around with.My experiences with the video quality have been very good.The BadThis camera does have a lens shadowing issue, it should only come up if you taking close pictures with the flash, but its still an issueLow-light performance is decent, but something like the Sony HX5V/B would probably be better if you plan on taking a lot of dark pictures, but this camera is still a lot better than your average point and shoot.It is one of the slowest shooting cameras in this price range, a dirty trick to get around this is to put the camera in low light mode and it takes pictures very fast. For me this hasn't been an issue.Whether this camera is worth it or not really depends on what features your looking for in a camera. Personally, I spent a lot of time researching other cameras and I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Professional Photographers Know: It's like a Portable DSLR.
Reviews.Author: Premium Outlets Giftcard Customer "thenonhacker"
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Excellent photos, great lens range, strong camera body.- The sensor captures rich rich tones in my photos.- I wish that the next version will make Wide Angle wider and Zoom Mode deeper, with a the same form factor.- I accidentally dropped this camera from my chest level to the cement floor. The corner metal is a bit dented. But my camera is still working! :D  This camera is so strong! Next time I'll be more careful, of course.- You can zoom while taking videos, and the quality is good. Compare this to SD800 IS, where video zoom is fake. SX200 IS Video Zoom is real, direct from the lens.- With a tripod and proper settings, night or low-light photos are glorious.- At last, someone has dedicated a separate "Play" button for viewing photos. You can turn on the camera with this button to view photos, and the lens will not expand.Cons:- Battery indicator still unpredictable, just like more cameras. It's important to have an extra battery.- I wish the aperture can be up to f/2- I wish it the lens range will be expanded further. Make it 18mm Wide Angle, and yet it's 32x Zoom!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 14x (Purple)
Reviews.Author: maddie
Reviews.Content: Perfect slim camera with a powerful zoom. Small & lightweight. I have a large camera with a 14x zoom. It is bulky and too large to slip in your purse. This camera has it all for the quick photos you do not want to miss, just point and shoot! For the everyday photos you can not go wrong. The flash placement is awkward and taking some getting use to, other than that I can't say enough about the overall quality of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: ersaurabhex
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera with amazing picture quality. I like the feature of quickly on/off of flash. I haven't explored it much but whatever I saw ..really nice!!

Reviews.Title: Great buy! Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mystery Reader
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what I was looking for, 14 megapixels, 14x zoom, easy to use, nice compact size and great pictures. Lots of options for taking photos in all types of light, huge LCD display screen. It lives up to the Canon name.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera, Nice Photos . . . Flash is tough.
Reviews.Author: Lucy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera.  I am very impressed with the picture quality.  The display is large and clear in good conditions, but in bright light I cannot see anything.  The controls on the back of the camera take a bit of getting used to, bc they are small.  Out of the box, you can definitely point and shoot but to really be able to understand this camera requires reviewing the manual.  The zoom is great.The biggest drawback of this camera is the pop up flash, where it pops up is where your hand would normally rest to hold the camera steady to take a photo.  It is almost a deal breaker for me.I bought it Dec 2011 for about $250 on Amazon.com.Hope this helps you.  Happy Shopping.

Reviews.Title: Wow! What a camera!
Reviews.Author: Julian M. Herzfeld
Reviews.Content: After having bought 8 of these for my work, I was blown away by the quality and feature set.My step-daughter asked for a point and shoot camera for Christmas and this was the obvious choice.

Reviews.Title: Almost DSLR Clarity
Reviews.Author: David Ojserkis
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical at first when I first purchased this device, 14mp with  a 14 zoom made me feel like every other feature on this device would be no good. I was quite wrong.The device itself has a stunning array of features. What I enjoy the most is the clarity of the pictures I take thanks to the high mega pixels, good optics, and huge zoom that is provided by this camera. The camera even can recognize and interface with my Eye-Fi Card, something I have not been able to do on previous point and shoots. I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Corey
Reviews.Content: I've been using this for a few weeks now, it works amazing! The only downfall this camera has (in my opinion) is the location of the flash. You will get used to where it is, not a big deal. Other than that, this camera has excellent features with amazing image quality. The zoom is superior, 14x optical with 56x digital. One note, i figured that the digital zoom would be lousy, I was wrong. The super zoom does focus even at 56x! This keeps amazing me! But camera I've ever owned!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with it!
Reviews.Author: Love my canons!
Reviews.Content: I love Canons and when I decided to upgrade my "purse camera" as I like to call it...I immediately looked to Canon.  I have the Rebel T1i and love it so I wanted a compact camera with good quality.  I heard mixed reviews, looked at different brands and even different models within the Powershot family.  SO HAPPY with my choice!  I have no complaints!  Btw, I take approximately 5,000 pictures a year...so many of them are with my Powershot!

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Camera in its Class with highest zoom!
Reviews.Author: gadget guru
Reviews.Content: After reading most of the reviews that seem to have complained about some shadow that shows up in pictures, I decided to check it out myself. I didn't find that problem with my camera. The fact is that this is a great camera and very close to an SLR. It takes beautiful crisp pictures. The low light pictures are great, too. It has tons of features that give you control over ISO. It focuses on more than one face and helps with blinks too! I've owned several SLRs (Minolta and Nikon) but I wanted a small pocket size with a high zoom feature that I can grab on the go. This is it. Great macro shots and much more. Anyone who owns this camera should become familiar with it and play with settings to find what works best for them. Sure it's not perfect... The flash pops up where you would normally hold the camera with your left hand but it's not a deal breaker for me. Far better than having to carry a heavy SLR! I just LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: CANON SX210
Reviews.Author: Esther M. Kinney
Reviews.Content: I am VERY happy with this camera.  I read some negative reviews about the zoom button, but I don't have a problem with it at all.  The same is true with the function dial.  I have no problems operating this, and find the entire camera super easy to use.  This is my fourth camera purchase this year.  This, and my original Canon SD780 are my favorites.  The only minor thing I don't like is where the built in flash is.  I tend to hold onto the camera at that spot, and when the flash is up, I tend to block it with my finger.  I'm certain I don't understand this design decision, but it's not that big of a deal to me.  I bought this camera because of the 14X zoom, not knowing much about them.  I like it very much, but in order to stay steady at 14X, one definately needs a tripod.  The movies I've taken have been surprisingly good, with no effort what-so-ever on my part.  All in all, I think this is a great camera.  Getting the camera, a spare battery and a 4GB SDHC card for under $205.00 from Amazon sealed the deal!  I'd do it again.  This camera is everything they said it was, plus...

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: lbj
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves this camera!  It is easy to use and lightweight.  I looked at a lot of cameras and got this one with great features on sale so we saved a lot of cash.  The only problem is finding a bag to fit it in the same color scheme.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Cynthia L. Hix "HOOKED ON COOKBOOKS"
Reviews.Content: I had purchased one for my husband last year and when my daughter needed a new camera, I knew exactly what she was going to get!  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price
Reviews.Author: C. Hardy
Reviews.Content: The zoom is wonderful and the camera itself has many good features. It has a solid build and pop up flash. The only problem I have with the camera is the position the pop up flash sits. Once you get used to it however the flash is a non issue. The best way to use this camera is not in the auto position, but rather the adjust the settings and take time to get perfect shots. Great camera overall. I purchased for $200 on black friday.

Reviews.Title: best zoom on a little point & shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Flavie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera (as did two of my relatives) for two reasons: I gave it to my daughter before she went to Africa (and on a safari) so she could take amazing photos with a pocket size camera, and it didn't disappoint. It has a 14X OPTICAL zoom - rare for a small digital camera! Others were amazed at the zoom capabilities compared to their SLR cameras. I then took it on a trip to Yellowstone, and was thrilled by my photos. Zooming in on black bears made it look like I was standing right in front of them!The second reason was price. When I saw the 'Black Friday' special, I told my relatives and three of us ordered the camera..... I've been watching the price on it since purchasing my daughter's early last summer, and saved over $100 on this one!Only drawback I've experienced is the flash - it pops up right where your left hand would hold the camera. This takes a bit of getting used to, having to change your grip (hopefully in the future Canon will redesign this). This is my 4th digital Canon camera in a row - I'm definitely a fan!

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera
Reviews.Author: sam
Reviews.Content: Decent Camera with good Picture quality ,Although I could not find this specified in any of the manufacturers information on line, I didsee in the accompanying documentation that Canon recommends the user buy a flash card that is atleast 15mb/s. This is also called a class 4 flash card.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: Jasmine
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my honeymoon to Europe (it's not 'til September), and I absolutely LOVE it. It's really lightweight for a camera that takes such amazing photos. It's definitely worth the price. I have a blog, and I've had readers commenting on my picture quality...I used a Canon Rebel digital SLR for my blog before. I highly recommend this camera to anyone who wants an easy-to-use, lightweight camera that takes really beautiful, high quality images.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera, but could have been better designed
Reviews.Author: ManSher
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera, an amazing amount of quality in a small container which is good looking. I had seriously looked at the Panasonic Lumix ZS6 and ZS7, but chose the Canon Powershot SX210IS, based on reviews and specs.  The picture quality is good, as is the video.  Low light pictures are OK.  My main problem is that the designers forgot that humans have to hold it. The flash, which rises up when the camera is switched on, is located where the left forefinger naturally holds the camera.  Since my forefinger is pressing on top of the flash, the flash does not rise up, and is interpreted by the camera as that I do not wish to use the flash.  Since I normally use the flash as a fill-in, I have to pull out the flash manually.  This is a continuous nuisance.The camera is small and light, and I am afraid it will slip out from my hands. The small hand strap is liable slip off easily.  A longer strap, for hanging around the neck would help.The absence of a print manual just makes the learning that much slower.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera For a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Spitfire Lover
Reviews.Content: Even though this was a Christmas present, I got to pick out my camera and this is the one I chose for a number of reasons.  The top reason is the optical zoom.  Having a camera that is this compact with an optical zoom of 14x is amazing and blows my old Canon SD1000 IS's optical zoom of only 3x out of the water.  Next, would be the functionality.  The SX210 IS is a nice middle of the road offering between the ELPH line and Canon's DSLR cameras, so it has some advanced features that advanced shooters will enjoy but it still retains some of the fun effects that are offered in the ELPH cameras (such as color swap, fisheye, and miniature effect).  Honestly, the 14.1mp didn't sway me that much (I immediately set it to 9mp) but the clarity is amazing.  Another nice feature is being able to shoot video in HD.  I haven't connected the camera to the TV yet (with the provided stereo AV cable) but if it's anywhere nearly as clear as it is on the 3" widescreen, then I'm sure it'll look quite nice.  I still have to tinker with different outdoor settings but I'm pleased that I haven't seen the bottom corner shadow that some people reported (though I think that might have been due more to poor photo composition rather than a performance issue on the camera's part).  So I say all that to say that I'm very pleased with my gift and look forward to many years with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: PMS
Reviews.Content: First my daughter wanted me to go in with her on this camera for Christmas for her Marine son who is going to Afghanistan. I did. On Thanksgiving at my house I found out my Montana granddaughter wanted a camera for Christmas & I was asked again to help. I did. She & her mom went shopping online & found this one for her in gold. After they left I bought a black one for me & one for my daughter in Texas for Christmas. Since then, one of her daughters got one for Christmas also. I have had 2 digital cameras. This one has to be the greatest! We bought 5 in less than 2 weeks. Fast & Fun. Small, lens protected, image stabilization - love it..

Reviews.Title: Zoom is great, but.....
Reviews.Author: Lola
Reviews.Content: I rely on reviews very much before I make any purchase, and the reviews were great on this camera. But I am disappointed in some of it's functions. I like most people wanted to find a camera that is easy to use and takes quality pictures, I was also looking for one that had really good zoom.The first thing I noticed that I wasn't totally happy with is that the flash opens right where most people place there fingers to hold onto the camera. There has been a few times that I have turned the camera on and without realizing that my finger is on the flash so it doesn't open. I have to turn the camera on then off again to get it to open.The second thing was the power button is way too small. I have petite hands and fingers, but I have to make sure I push right in the center of the button to turn the camera on. This can be annoying when I am in a hurry to capture that perfect picture.The zoom is unbelievable, but the more you zoom in the more shaky the image gets on the screen and the longer it takes for the camera to focus. This has caused me to miss some shots or to have shaky videos.Lastly, it is not all that easy to use. I am not the best with technically but I'm not the worst either. I read through the manual, but it's pretty hard to remember all of the functions and how to get to them without it. Hopefully this will become easier with time.The camera is lightweight, small, does take wonderful pictures when you have the time to zoom, click and wait. I do not suggest this camera however if your trying to capture anything that is moving or you need to capture something quickly.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: P. Johnson
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for someone who wants great pictures with ease of shooting and all the extras - especially the video option and the smart shooting option so you don't have to guess.  Also, the indoor setting gives you great pictures! After buying and using this camera I bought one for my friend and she loves it too.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with the best zoom we've found
Reviews.Author: Laura A. Mcghghy
Reviews.Content: The zoom on this camera makes it worth the 5 stars.  The flash does sometimes get in the way of my husband's hand (he's left handed and the flash pops up on left side of camera).It takes good HD movie quality video with good sound.

Reviews.Title: The perfect camera
Reviews.Author: Allyson
Reviews.Content: This little camera is amazing! I had been slowly working my way up to owning a professional camera with the hopes and dreams of becoming a wildlife photographer when life threw me for a loop and suddenly i'm going to be living pretty much out of a suitcase for a very long amount of time. So i packed up my beloved old camera and sold it and then wanted a new camera that was small, had lots of settings, good megapix, a great zoom, and that i loved. This camera is so perfect, i couldn't be happier with my choice and with the photos that it takes! just took my family pictures last week, and will be taking some engagement/wedding photos with it this next week!

Reviews.Title: I'm happy with it.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer James
Reviews.Content: After long hours spent reading reviews, visiting store displays and comparing other cameras I settled on this.  My original intention was to get the smaller point and shoot, but I'm glad I settled on this for the longer zoom.  It performed very well in low light - I prefer to use the flash as little as possible.  I love that I can just push the flash down insuring it doesn't go off when I don't intend for it to.  I mainly used the preset settings because I didn't have time to read the instruction manual before my trip.  As a novice, those pictures came out better than when I tried to control the settings in all but one instance.  After borrowing a friend's older canon for a few shots, I realized how helpful the optical stabilizer on this is to me.  Similar shots with the two cameras came out much clearer on mine.  My only complaint is that it's just a bit slower than I'd like.  I got most of the shots I wanted but was a bit slow on a couple and missed the shot.  I knew that going in, but despite that still felt it was the best camera out of all those that had similar features and price.  I made sure to charge the battery every day as I was taking a lot of pictures.  The two times I didn't charge or fully charge my battery died before I was done shooting.

Reviews.Title: absolutely amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Live.laugh.LOVE
Reviews.Content: Great camera! I looked around for months for the perfect one to take on my study abroad experience for the upcoming semester. LOVE the zoom. This nifty little camera can do so much! It so far has taken amazing pictures, better than my boyfriends nine hundred dollar camera. All the functions and options you can do with this camera are perfect. The one thing I don't like is where the flash is positioned. It flips open and is exactly where your finger would be when you normally hold a camera to take a picture. Luckily, canon has built the flash so that you can open and hold shut the flash manually without breaking it. I would definitely buy this camera for your wife, husband, son, daughter, or even parents. Top Camera for the 2010 Christmas season. Anyone would love to have this under their tree.

Reviews.Title: First Canon! Love it!
Reviews.Author: Nancy Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: This is my first Canon, I have previously owned a Samsung, Sony, and Kodak and I am very impressed with this camera. I was simply looking for a camera with great picture quality and I found it. Video quality is great too. I stay on the auto setting most of the time and it does a good time adjusting everything. Not much to say really except I'm not disappointed and would highly recommend this camera. O yeah, my friends even commented on the quality of my pictures when I uploaded them to facebook!

Reviews.Title: Canon Compact
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: Had it for a few months and am very, very pleased.  Small, excellent quality, great zoom, etc.  It's all I was hoping it would be.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Paul Horn
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a more portable option to my slr and have found the quality of the results so amazing that it has become the only camera I need.  The macro is great and I love the color effects.  The zoom and IS are top notch too.

Reviews.Title: WideWorld Magazine Review the Canon
Reviews.Author: Gareth Rowson
Reviews.Content: We put the Canon SX210 IS to the test in low light with fast moving objects. While impressed with the results, both in video and still, the only major downside was the drive/processing speed.See the video here [...]Or read the WideWorld Magazine review in full here [...]

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Becky Cournia
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera.  I previously had an older Canon Digital Elph and it worked great for a while, but I was in search of a larger zoom and a camera that tok stellar photos in low and dark light.  I found it in this camera.  Recently went on a camping trip and took photos by the campfire in the night setting - photos turned out like it was daylight.  I definitely recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX210IS
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: I researched this camera on Amazon and another site or two and it works just like the other reviews said it would.  Out of the box, took amazingly clear 14 mp pics.  Zoom is very clear.  I don't know how to use all the settings like flower mode; the book is a little skimpie, but I will review the enclosed CD.

Reviews.Title: Great cemera beyond our expectation
Reviews.Author: H. YU
Reviews.Content: At first, we bought this one because, on the paper, it is good at taking steady photos without blurring problem.But when we start to use it, it exceeds all our expectation from this camera.It's a easy to use point-and-shoot camera, but also a SLR camera with many advance functions.The face recognition function works great as advertised.The HD video was really sharp and clear, although the size of file is huge as expected.It can easily take picture of stars at night with 15 sec. exposure time,and many other cool functions.Althoung the location of flash light makes it a little difficult to hold camera,it is a overall great camera.

Reviews.Title: Good travel camera
Reviews.Author: Marlene E. Bryant "Garden bird"
Reviews.Content: I have several cameras, so I really have not used this very much as yet.  The biggest problem I find is that my finger is always on the area where the flash pops up when you turn on the camera.  Because of the finger being there, it keeps the flash down which may not be a good thing.  I have to try to remember to move my finger before turning it on.  Other than that, I am quite pleased with this camera.  Love the zoom range, and pixels.  I would recommend it for sure !!

Reviews.Title: outstanding product
Reviews.Author: allawi
Reviews.Content: Just bought one. great optical zoom and image quality. great image stabilizer. good value for product. battery life reasonable.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Price for all the New Technology
Reviews.Author: Stephanie DePue
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot SX210IS digital camera is a newly released, slim, elegant and powerful product that packs a surprising number of features into its small body.  Apparently, it was designed for advanced amateur photographers, and offers 14.1 mega pixels, 14x wide zoom, and 3.0" wide LCD.My purchase process here was a bit unusual for lazy old me: I needed a new camera, so first went online, looked up the ratings of digital cameras.  Made up a short list of likely candidates by price and quality, went to Amazon and checked on the early users' reviews.  Everyone raved about this new one, coming out soon, so I bit.Well, there's no question, the camera is cleverly made.  It seems to have, let's call it, a plain vanilla auto, it doesn't allow manual control of the flash, but it will just take pictures.  Then it's got a Smart Auto setting. Allows manual control of the flash.  And it knows what's in your potential picture: human beings, or just scenery.  Knows when more human beings enter the picture, and adjusts itself.  Also knows if you are in close-up, bright light, backlit light, blue skies and backlit blue skies, sunsets, or dark.  And adjusts itself for all of the above, which is pretty remarkable to me.  It'll shoot short movies of course.  It has manual settings appropriate for amateur photographers, such as people, landscape, night, kids and pets, and indoors and something called smart shutter.  It doesn't have a sports setting, unfortunately, which my previous camera did: guess you'd take sports in the kids/pets setting.  It's also got a setting that adjusts portrait/landscape, and settings for the more advanced that I'll probably never use, to change aperture and speed.I do have a couple of quibbles with it.  It has no built-in memory, and doesn't come with a memory card, so you can't use it right out of the box, unless you've a memory card handy.  It also comes with only a very small booklet, "Getting Started," instead of a full manual, that too makes it more difficult to use right out of the box. The full manual comes on CD as 150 pages of PDF.  I'd prefer to have this information in hard copy, but my little home system can't possibly print 150 pages.  I've been told by other more knowledgeable users that that's the way better digital cameras are shipped today, and I can't argue with them.  So, buy a hard-copy manual from the vendor?  Anyway, guess both of these deficiencies were dictated by the desire to bring the camera in at the best possible price, and it does come at a very good price for all the exciting new technology it bears.  If you want a good new digital camera at a good price, you ought to consider this one.

Reviews.Title: Not a great camera
Reviews.Author: Foxy "foxykhat"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in the Cayman's while on a cruise about two years ago when my Sony Cybershot died on me.  I was happy I was rekindling with Canon and had only switched to Sony because the Canon I previously owned was not small enough.I can't say I'm extremely happy with the camera.  I have tried several settings but my pictures are always a disappointed.  Like most I'm puzzled this camera is getting such great reviews. I'm not searching for a new camera.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't recommend it to anyone
Reviews.Author: Walter Orellana
Reviews.Content: I read a lot before buying this, the main problem with it is it's shutter lag and the complexity to make your own settings, the picture quaility is just okay. If you are to buy a compact camera don't think twice, spend a couple of more bucks and get the LX-5, that one is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Review of Canon SX210is
Reviews.Author: D. E. Pitts
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my mother who is by no means technically savvy.  She has had the camera about a month and has taken it on one trip already.  The camera is very easy for her to operate and the screen is improved from other Canons.  The use of this camera in low light is one of many reasons I chose it.  The main downside of the camera is a design flaw:  where one would traditionally hold a camera there is a pop up flash which is held down by your left index finger.  Avoiding this causes you to hold the camera a bit awkward.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: burt
Reviews.Content: I purchased Both a SX210 and a ZS7 because Amazon reviews indicated that they were both excellant cameras and I could not decide which one to buy so I now have 2 great (small) cameras. After taking neumerus pictures and video I determined that the 2 cameras were both high quality with great video. I especially liked the date stamp feature in the SX210 and I liked the instant creation of High definition (AVCHD) DVDs using the included Panasonic ZS7 software program. Otherwise the 2 cameras were equivelant and I am very happy with both.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Em "emrt13"
Reviews.Content: Bought this Camera in Walmart (its more expensive there)Awesome little camera, idle for people wanting a profession style camera small enough to fit in your pocket!!I won't go into detail, this truly is a great little camera, the more I play with it the more and more I like it!Well worth a buy!

Reviews.Title: Fully-loaded camera
Reviews.Author: John V. Harper
Reviews.Content: The SX210IS is an impressive camera. I got it because of the 14 to 1 optical zoom. Like any sophisticated camera, it takes time to learn how to take excellent pictures with it. Easy mode works for a lot of situations, put anyone wanting consistently good results will have to learn to use the program mode. I found that taking outdoor shots in easy mode leads to pictures looking flat. Also, you'll have to do some experimentation if you want to properly handle situations where there is light coming from behind the subject. I am not used to the auto focus process where I have to push the button half way to get the auto focus to work. Auto focus can be turned off, but then I have to worry that when I ask someone to take a photograph of me, the picture may not be in focus. I love the video on the camera, but again, the auto focus can be a problem.

Reviews.Title: MUST get a case!
Reviews.Author: pogopogo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and used it for a family vacation to France.  I put a premium on mobility and so tend to carry cameras in a pocket (otherwise empty, not with keys, etc.)  This hasn't been a problem with previous powershots, but it is with this camera--within a week, detritus had worked its way into the lens mechanism.  I know I'll be blamed for not getting a case - and that's true - but the lens also isn't flush with the surrounding metal, and there's lots of moving parts here.  (The camera rattles if you shake it gently.)  So get a case, and be aware this item isn't all that robust or spontaneity friendly.Picture performance is on par with other point and shoots.  At this price-point it's worth thinking carefully how important mega-zoom and video are to you.  dSLR really is night-and-day better, and though more money obviously, at this price point you probably are considering saving for one, and I'd think hard about that.Last note: stabilization is pretty good for still pictures, a bit less so on video.  I get successful, non-blurry pics at maximum zoom, handheld.

Reviews.Title: This is a magnificant camera . . .
Reviews.Author: ecojackie "ecojackie"
Reviews.Content: I have been taking pictures for over 40 years and this is the best camera I have ever had. It takes the sharpest pictures, has the best metering system I have ever experienced, and the flash is great. The controls are easy to access and the menus are very well designed. I leave it in Program mode all the time and easily access the menu choices from the rotating dial next to the LCD. The battery is a champ and charges very fast (in about 45 minutes). I have a fancier, more expensive camera, but I haven't taken it out since I bought this little wonder. Also,it is small, but not too small. I have big hands and have returned smaller cameras that get lost in my hands. This one I can use and still stick it in my pocket if necessary. You will not be disappointed and at today's special price, I am thinking of buying a second one!

Reviews.Title: Camera Amatuer
Reviews.Author: E. Stevens
Reviews.Content: I have to use a SLR camera for work so I know a little about ISO, apature, etc. I was looking for a personal camera that is small but with some of the controls that I have learned how to use. When I saw a small camera with a 14x Optical zoom I was very happy. But when I bought it and tryed to use it I found it doesnt have a image stablizer (I tend to shake) The instruction say if it shows the shaking image to put it on a tripod (not very often possible). Most of my photos were blury. When they werent blury they were very nice shots.I also found it hard to figure out where the menus were to change the settings, like light, and picture size. As they dont print books anymore I was trying to figure out the camera without any help (yes I know its on CD but hard to take a computer out when you're taking photos).I had some trouble with depth of focus. The camera was focusing on the wrong subject which kept flustrating me.Worked well in low light. And I used the video camera feature and thought for a small camera it did well. Not perfect but I could hear the voices and the focus was good. Still not a video camera.So this camera is going back to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Battery Life is Terrible
Reviews.Author: L. McMillin "femmelady"
Reviews.Content: I've had mine a couple of days.  Agree with quite a bit of the first review.  We used our daughter's 110IS in Paris and loved it.  This one is smaller, but I'm not so sure I like the feel of it as well.  My biggest complaint is that the battery is discharging in one day after a couple of hours of use and a hundred or so pictures.  I've written the Amazon seller as it's probably a bad battery, but still.  I'm charging the 2nd one right now (I bought a package set), but if it discharges too, I will pack the whole thing up and send it back.I definitely agree that the mode dial is really difficult to turn.  They could really improve on that.  It's on the top and a bit awkward.  Also, this camera has more features than my daughters (like afore mentioned sepia, etc.), but I have not found the pictures to be as crisp.  I need to play with it a while, and perhaps mess with the ISO, but out of box on Auto, I'm not getting crisp fantastic picture like we got with the 110.  Maybe it was because we were in Paris!In addition, in Auto on the 110, you had a macro option.  Now, you have to switch to Program mode for macro.  That annoys me.  I also don't like the little zoom tool.  It's a small piece that sticks up and you move it left and right.  I just find it a little slow to use.  And agree on the mention of your finger is on the flash when you turn it on, which makes it stay down, even though it wants to pop up.The gold is lovely, so we'll see.  I probably need to play with it a while, but I was expecting WOW, especially in picture quality.  Shots are blurry and a little grainy, but it may be the settings and I need to practice with it.  Not quite point and shoot though, in my opinion.Review Update:It's been another week and I'm sending it back.  Butterfly Photo said the batteries that ship should last about an hour or two of use.  That's ridiculous.  Both of my batteries discharged in around that amount of time of use.  SO disappointing.  And then there's the crazy shadow in low light situations because the zoom goes out so far, it blocks the flash.  I'm going back to a AA lithium based, which lasts for longer than 2 hours.  More like 2 weeks of heavy use.Yesterday I charged the battery, and went to my nephews wedding.  Took about 30 pictures and 20 minutes of video.  Then made it to my daughter's performance, took another 20 minutes of video, and the low battery began to flash.  Aso, this camera is slow to shoot.

Reviews.Title: Lag Lag Lag
Reviews.Author: Lisa W "LRW"
Reviews.Content: There has been much written about this camera, I bought it based on good reviews but I returned it for one reason and one reason only- too much lag.  I photograph action almost exclusively and in continuous mode with a class 10 high speed card it was painfully slow.  I wanted to love this camera- still looking...

Reviews.Title: Returned
Reviews.Author: William H. Mourer "William"
Reviews.Content: I've had several Canon SD and SX cameras and were generally satisfied and considered myself very loyal to Canon products.  I returend this item after 1 day of testing it.  The zoom is extremely slow.  The picture quality is sub-standard for my taste.  The camera is weighty and actually difficult to hold, something about it's shape you don't feel you can get a good grip on it to point and shoot.  The on/off button on top is miniscule.  The zoom trigger, besides zooming slowly, it tiny and difficult to operate.  Basically the ergonomics just aren't there, along with slowness.  I'm going to try out the new Nikon S8000 and see how that goes.

Reviews.Title: What a disappointment!!!
Reviews.Author: Bob N.
Reviews.Content: Studied so many online reviews and thought this was the one!  What a disappointment.  After taking some pics, that look good enough on the camera...then downloaded to PC.  They are too soft and granulated when zooming in on the PC monitor.  Yuck!  My old Canon SD780IS was way better!  The camera has so many nice features, but the most important thing is good-quality pics! I am now shipping this back to Amazon, so glad that they allow returns!

Reviews.Title: Canon SX210IS
Reviews.Author: John C. Deshong Jr.
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for the SX210IS.Pros: It is feature laden and that was part of my interest in the camera. I especially liked the quick select option for the video. I also liked the CCD sensitivity and the 14X zoom feature. I probably took over a 1000 shots with the camera and had it 25 days. Basically I was comparing the performance to a Kodak Z981 camera, but of course the Canon SX210IS was smaller. I also take a lot of indoor videos of children. I also carried it on several birdwatching trips. I feel I gave the SX210IS a real test and I wasn't really happy with the overall usage of the camers.Cons:I was disappointed with the indoor videos because it really struggled with sensitivity. Part of the reason is the large zoom that reduces the sensitivity and one must be aware of that. I was also annoyed with the menu settings that continully were somehow wrong, and in birdwatching, you don't have time to search around in menues. The Kodak Z981 was so much easier to navigate and get to what you wanted quickly. The only plus that I gave the Canon SX210IS over the Kodak Z981 was a quieter zoom lens action. However, another negative is that the Canon zoom is much slower than the Kodak zoom. I really got poor birdwatching pictures most of the time,and even worse with the extended digital zoom. I tried all of the optional Mode choices and again was frustrated with navigating menu issues.There is no viewfinder and trying to use it in bright light is difficult. I like a viewfinder but it is missing, which is sad on a camera in this price category.I really wanted to like this camera, but I finally returned it because it just isn't easy to use.I also use a Pentax DSLR as well as my Kodak Z981 and I like both of these camera's user interface much better than the Canon. I think Canon needs to put more emphasis on the user interface.

Reviews.Title: Problem with video focusing
Reviews.Author: Ezequiel de la Carcova
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of Canon. I used to have de Canon S1 Is and S3 Is and now I bought this one I'm a bit dissapointed with the video because it has serious problem when focusing. The image comes and goes. I don't know whats the problem. May be Canon have to release a new firmware to correct this problem.

Reviews.Title: not the greatest picture quality
Reviews.Author: J. C.
Reviews.Content: even though the product has high megapixels, the digital picture quality is not as great as my old olympus camera which only had 5 megapixels.  very disappointed as generally cannons are known for its quality.

Reviews.Title: Slow, slow, slow - not a good camera if you have kids
Reviews.Author: Sugardoll
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the positive reviews for this camera.  I hate it with a passion.  I bought it as a compromise between my old clunky Olympus 12x zoom and my compact Canon Powershot 4x zoom, both of which had started to malfunction.  I thought this camera would have it all - great pictures, powerful zoom, in a compact body.  I was wrong.  This camera is slow, SLOW, S-L-O-W!!!  Takes too long to focus, terrible shutter lag so that you often miss the shot by the time the camera takes the photo.  Also takes much too long in between shots.  Its "burst" mode is laughable, don't even bother - .5 frames per second!!!  To get anything resembling a decent burst mode (such as when you want to capture action shots during your kids' soccer games), you need to lower the image resolution to capture more than half a shot per second, so much so that the pictures end up not being usable.  Not a good camera if you want to take photos of your kids - most of the time, you'll miss the shot.  Photo quality is nothing special.  Performance in low light is poor.  I've put this camera away and don't even use it anymore, I hate it so much.

Reviews.Title: Warranty not Honored
Reviews.Author: Mike "x1138"
Reviews.Content: In less than a year the automatic lens cover failed and the lens was not protected from debris. I shipped the camera to Canon Factory Service with the Amazon receipt as requested.  They sent me a letter requesting more than half of the cost of the camera to cover repair. When I called Canon Service they offered me a lesser product in return.  When I asked the representative why Canon offers an older model in return for the PowerShot SX210IS she replied, "That's just the way Canon does it." I also asked why the warranty did not cover repair costs and got the run-around.

Reviews.Title: Mucho mejor que Sony o Panasonic
Reviews.Author: Peralta
Reviews.Content: He tenido muchas cámaras tanto de video como de fotografía y esta es la mejor. El zoom 14x con el estabilizador de imagen funciona perfectamente, la claridad y luminosidad de las imágenes es sorprendente, los diferentes modos dan muchas posibilidades a la hora de ayudar a los que no conocen mucho de fotografía y, para los conocedores o mas avanzados, el modo de programa es muy versátil y permite anticipar buenos resultados. El video es excelente aunque en HD consume mucho espacio en la tarjeta SD pero el video es de MUY alta calidad y verdadera alta definición.He tenido cámaras Sony, Panasonic, Olympus y Canon, deifinitivamente esta Canon es MUY SUPERIOR.En resumen, muy satisfecho con esta adquisición.

Reviews.Title: a $99 camera could beat this camera in focusing
Reviews.Author: Niki
Reviews.Content: While this camera has a lot of features that are cool (ie: smile detection), it can't do the basics to a satisfactory level. When taking pictures between 2 and 10 feet, the focus is very poor. I am a professional photographer and I tried many MANY times to get a sharp picture out of this camera within arms length, and could not do it. Even within 5 feet I couldn't not get a sharp photo.They did a good job with the telephoto abilities, and the "extras," but if your camera you're putting out can't focus like it should for basic functioning, it shouldn't be on the market. Shame on you Canon.I got this for my dad after he lost his Canon SD1200 and that camera took far better photos as far as focus goes than this camera, which is $50 more in price.I'd take it back if I could.Splurge for a Nikon P7000 if you want something as good as the excellent quality this camera claims to have, or the SD1200 if you're ok with point and shoot quality.I'll post sample pictures in the examples album as well.

Reviews.Title: Okay, but a little disappointed
Reviews.Author: Lisa Aller
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a really reliable camera for clear photos and videos to record the growth of our new little baby.  I was willing to pay more for the Canon PowerShot SX2101S because I thought it would be a great camera.  Some times the photos I've taken have turned out great and I've been really pleased.  But other times the photos are blurry or the lighting is off.  Also, the video goes in and out of focus (even without using the zoom).

Reviews.Title: Decent compact camera
Reviews.Author: ronny111 "ron"
Reviews.Content: It was a steal at $200 right after Thanksgiving. It is built very well - Made in Japan - and attention to detail is apparent - that is why all the cameras I have owned for the last 20 years have been Canons. I take one star away for poorer than expected low light performance. It is especially bad at 14x. The image quality with poor indoor lighting, and no flash used is very poor. I doubt that any camera in this price range would do any better though. If you are looking for compact camera with superzoom and HD video capability this one if hard to beat, especially if you are partial to Japanese made products.After couple of months I have to take another star away. This camera's autofocus hunts way too much and out of about 300 pictures I took so far at least 50 were out of focus. I have not had this problem with my other Canons.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, Except for 2 issues !
Reviews.Author: M. Kennedy "mkennedy "shopper""
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for a trip to National Parks in the southwest.  The pictures turned out great.  I also brought along my old camera and my husband took pictures with it (Sony Cybershot).  His pictures didn't have the clarity and color that the Canon had.  The one major problem is the placement of the flash.  It's so annoying because you naturally put your finger in that position which stops the flash from popping up.  So you have to turn the camera off and then on again.Another issue I have with them is that they don't give you a printed user manual, it comes on a disk.  Who's going to print off 180 pages so they can have the user guide to take along on the trip?  Exactly!  Come on Canon, when you pay this much for a good camera, you need the hard copy of the user manual, don't be so cheap! Send us the user guide.

Reviews.Title: the place of the flash is not comfortable
Reviews.Author: M. Can Merter "CM"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera overall. The only downside is that the flash is located on the left hand corner and it comes out when you turn the camera on. This makes it a little bit harder to hold the camera from both sides to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: Glad I bought a Canon
Reviews.Author: savinggrace "savinggrace"
Reviews.Content: Sturdy metal case. Ready to shoot right away. I can't imagine how they packed all the features in such a small unit. It is much smaller than my SLR, but has more features. Easy to figure out the menu and buttons.

Reviews.Title: focalicious
Reviews.Author: Beary000
Reviews.Content: This little camera has so many special features I cannot mention them all.Focus your most distant subject, color your photo in a wash of red, or other special effects.Lots of fun, small enough to carry every where.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera!
Reviews.Author: Wolfarrow "Wolfarrow"
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning all the features this camera has capabilities to perform! It's so easy to use and I especially love the 14x zoom! The pop-up flash is on the top edge of the body and easy to cover up with finger.  Be sure to position your finger on the side of the camera to allow the flash to automatically pop-up.  I love the small, sleek design and amazing zoom for a point & shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: A++
Reviews.Author: Jennifer H. Cunningham
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  Takes wonderful shots and is very easy to use, even for a novice.  Fantastic zoom for such a small camera.  I like being able to control  the flash by manually closing it.  Good for action shots and low light shots as well.

Reviews.Title: this is the best camera
Reviews.Author: vinod
Reviews.Content: I love using this camera. I am using this camera for around 2-years and still its working in great condition. No problems and high picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Paul J.
Reviews.Author: Paul J. Petrulis
Reviews.Content: Had this camera several years now and it always works perfectly and takes great pictures. I never purchased a Cannon product before, and after owning one of their products, I will look at their line first the next time that I am interested in buying. Extremely satisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: Good choice
Reviews.Author: Paulo Marcio Brandi Rezende
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a small cam but with enough features and very good optical zoom, this is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: This little thing is very sharp.
Reviews.Author: Leon Wechsler "LW"
Reviews.Content: This little thing is very sharp. It does everything I want and much, much more. I never got the time or opportunity to use more then the two auto features.

Reviews.Title: a nice camera in a very small package
Reviews.Author: Annie M. Salmona "knitting frenzy"
Reviews.Content: camera is a powerful unit in a small package. we purchased this camera to replace my husband's xs200is. it took a little while to learn how to use this camera but the time spent on learning the features is well worth it. the zoom is very powerful, however it is difficult to take pictures in low light. but this inconvenience is balanced by the very fine definition of the pictures. my husband is missing his "sunset" setting however.  we have been trying to find out how to get this setting via other means. these new cameras have a lot going for them, and most people do not take the time to learn how to use them. this is one camera that has to be studied a bit and experimented with.

Reviews.Title: Loved it at first.
Reviews.Author: Kuke
Reviews.Content: This camera worked great  - for a while.  When I was into my second week in Italy, it quit reading a charged battery so I was unable to use it.  Good thing I had a camcorder and iPad with me, but what a hassle!  I'm very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 14x Wide Angle Optical...
Reviews.Author: BionikMan
Reviews.Content: This is my second Canon PowerShot SX210IS. Nothing happened to the first, just bought this as a backup. No, I am not a photographer, but do drop things now and than. Takes magnificent photos, easy to hold, fast enough for stills, video is excellent, battery recycle time is good, and is still rated a top contender compared to newer models. Being quite versed in photography, knowing shutter speed and aperture priority, except for automatic mode, the other modes are just too complicated for my use. In its hay-days, I preferred the manual film cameras such as the Minolta SRTs. But, time moves on.

Reviews.Title: The BEST Camera
Reviews.Author: S.A.A.LM "M.P.L."
Reviews.Content: I can't describe how great this camera is..it is one of my favorite cameras of its class. I am not a photographer and know nothing about taking good pictures but this camera makes me look like a pro-photographer. It has a great great stabilizer for shaky hands (like mine!) and it works nice even without flash for moderate light. I LOVE this camera so much.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: Joyce Sorensen
Reviews.Content: good product, good price, easy to use and as advertized.......I'm enjoying this camera and hope to use it for awhile

Reviews.Title: Tired
Reviews.Author: ~Kara Christy~
Reviews.Content: This camera makes me very tired.Yes it can take beautiful photos, but they are few and far between. In the meantime my camera and laptop are full of blurry, unfocused and dark pictures that are there to remind me of moments I didn't capture on film because this camera does not perform its main function very well, point and shoot. Worst of all is the shutter lag and I've owned many cameras over the years as a semi pro and with no other camera in my collection do i have to take so many repeated photos of the same subject to get desirable results, no matter how much I fine tune the manual settings.So the end result is extreme frustration and only marginal photos. I gave this camera a chance for 2 years but comparing my photos from these 2 years to the ones taken before on a Canon SD1000 the difference is clear... and quite sad, so many moments that could have looked so much better on a different camera.I gave the camera 2 and a half star for the amazing photos it can produce when the stars align but I bought this camera for the amazing zoom and with the terrible image quality and the difficult time it has taking the photos it's just not been worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for product photography
Reviews.Author: Ian M Kennedy
Reviews.Content: I sell jewelry and decor online and this little workhorse pumps out great quality photos and can handle macro details on small items.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: G. Blais
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this camera.  An excellent performer.  Quality of images is great.  Really nothing bad to say about it.  Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Bell
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this. Good zoom. Good picture quality. The only thing I can think of that would be considered negative would be that the flash is placed exactly where you want to put your finger. Other than that, everything is great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera!
Reviews.Author: Fizgig
Reviews.Content: So many settings to tinker with, so little time =)  This little camera rivals the functionality and flexibility of a DSLR but is much smaller.  Takes superb shots!  The better you know how to customize settings, the better the results -- yes, it can help a budding photographer learn due to the number of settings the user can control.  The only thing I don't like (and it's relatively minor) is that the flash pops up automatically when the camera is turned on regardless of what mode the camera is in -- I'd forgive it on the automatic modes, but it shouldn't pop up when shooting in manual or P.  That flash preference wouldn't keep me from purchasing this camera again, though.

Reviews.Title: Decent enough
Reviews.Author: Santhosh Kumar Varma P
Reviews.Content: Easy to use . Decent camera for a basic use . Has decent features and recommended for price conscious people

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Lisa Mizer
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera.  Purchased it so I would have a good camera to take on my honeymoon.  The pictures were clear and I have never had a problem with it.

Reviews.Title: 2 years of use
Reviews.Author: Cliff
Reviews.Content: This takes incredible photos if there is a lot of light.  But even with every light on in our house, indoors it fails.  I know you can play with the settings and I have taken college level photography classes and I still cant get great photos indoors.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: jaruska
Reviews.Content: We own older Canons and the advancement is remarkable.  Could not find this one at the stores any more.  Highly satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Sam Winchester "Sammy"
Reviews.Content: A compact camera with big camera capablities.  Yes, it takes some reading on how to use the settings as well as some trial, error and research on how to take a good picture using settings other than "automatic".  Once you get that down, you're golden.  It's got a big screen, a good zoom for what it is and multiple functions to take excellent and unique photos.  I know that I've taken many that do not even need to be photoshopped before printing and framing, the photos were that good, or maybe it was just me.  Regardless, I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Lovemydogs
Reviews.Content: I got this at a great price and have had a couple years now. It's a great point and shoot camera that I've recommended to friends. The zoom is awesome.

Reviews.Title: packs a great punch for the  buck
Reviews.Author: Surra
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few years now and even though I own DSLRs, this little thing is still my go to camera when I need decent quality pictures and not in the mood to pack a huge camera bag.  The pictures are of decent quality, and the camera has great battery life. There are a number of settings that I love using, primarily tilt-shift mode manages to make boring things quite interesting.What sets this camera aside from all others is its amazing durability, this little thing has survived a minor flood (not that I recommend this for pooltime), a number of accidental drops, a few stomps, a toddler chewing on it and an overzealous dog. It's got the scars to prove it! If you're looking for a point and shoot that's got it all, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Perfection!
Reviews.Author: Ronald Brooks
Reviews.Content: Reviewed by my wife--I'm a pretty experienced photographer, but couldn't bear with the thought of taking my beloved Canon dSLR on a cruise. Instead, I searched high and low for the perfect compact camera and fell in love with the Canon PowerShot SX210IS. I purchase it in 2010 before my honeymoon to the Bahamas and have used it for multiple vacations since. It will go fully automatic, which is rare in a point and shoot, and it takes amazing photos. I've taken shots in Nassau, Freeport, Cocoa Beach, Miami, Charleston, St. Thomas, Grand Turk, Half Moon Cay, San Juan, Nags Head, Washington D.C., etc. It'll also be with me this fall when I visit Mexico, Belize and Isla Roatan. The only time I've ever had any problem with photo quality is in some low light situations where I refused to use the flash. I prefer natural light and only use the flash when forced to. The zoom is more than adequate and the picture quality is superb. I absolutely recommend this camera. It's the only one I can find that can stand up to my dSLR.

Reviews.Title: Extremely nice point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Sunny
Reviews.Content: It is an extremely nice point and shoot camera which suffices all basic needs. Very happy with the pictures and value for money.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: Kelsey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera used and it seems to work great.  The camera is very small and can easily fit in my bag.  The flash is kind of in a strange place.

Reviews.Title: Great Cam
Reviews.Author: Yemu
Reviews.Content: The only issue i face with this cam is the flash is placed in the wrong place, everything else is very good. I got it for great deal. thats y i love it

Reviews.Title: A Disappointment
Reviews.Author: N. De Rosa
Reviews.Content: I have been a long-time Canon customer (30 years) and, over the years,  have owned many of their products including (back in the film days)  the top of the line F-1 and A-1.  I purchased this camera, as a "pocket" camera,  about a year ago to replace a Canon Digital ELPH SD 500.  That was a mistake.  I have found that the images produced by this camera are substandard, dark and flat causing me to edit and brighten each and every picture through iphoto before I add them to our digital albums.  Further, and perhaps the most frustrating problem, is the verrrrry slow autofocus which causes me to miss many photo opportunities.  I have now gone back to using my Canon ELPH as a pocket camera because it is much smaller and therefore more convenient to carry and the images and autofocus are no worse than the SX210is.  Irrespective of my 30 years of brand loyalty, I would give this one a pass.

Reviews.Title: This camera is a trooper!
Reviews.Author: ItalianCypress
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take with me to China.  I dropped it at the Great Wall and I was so sure it was toast but it lived!  It is all banged up and has had many falls into pavement and it is still functioning.  Family, friends, and co-workers are so impressed with my beat up camera they all own one too.  Battery lasts a long time but if you are constantly turning it off and on it wears faster.  Video and sound are good.  Recording reduces power and causes the camera to over heat if you film over five minutes.My only complaint is I bought a 16G card for it and the card freezes between 4G and 8G.  I read that you should not use a card larger than 8G with this camera and they weren't lying.  I suggest owning two cards in case the card freezes.

Reviews.Title: 2nd canon that takes blurry pics
Reviews.Author: Dave H
Reviews.Content: I like the fast response, but this is my 2nd canon that does not seem to take clear pics.  Also, when I was video'ing my son's xmas show, the focus kept going in and out in and out.  very disconcerting.  Finally, I really dislike the location of the flash.  I am always accidentally pushing it down.  It needs to be integrated into the frame and not be a pop up.

Reviews.Title: Pocket power.
Reviews.Author: k.supplee
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this picture quality this little guy puts out. I took in on a road trip recently, and logged in over 1000 photos. After weeding out some, the remaining pics I had were excellent, and all worthy of printing out. Some people have told me that there are a few Nat Geo worthy pics in there, which is always a compliment.Zoom is also fantastic. I will post up some pictures from Glacier Nat. Park showing the zoom quality soon. The size is also a great perk. It fits in a back jean pocket perfectly with no discomfort. Get this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love this purple camera!
Reviews.Author: bdomingu
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after going on a camping trip with some friends who had this camera.  She had just purchased it and was "playing" around with it all weekend.  I didn't use it personally, but she raved about how much she liked it.  3 weeks before taking my son to Disneyland for the first time, my orginal camera came up missing.  After turning the house upside down for a week, I decided that my camera was gone and needed to purchase a new one before our trip.  After a few days of reading endless reviews, I settled on this camera and I couldn't be happier!First of all, I got the camera about 3 days before we left for our trip, so I didn't have much time to learn how to use it.  That said, for a low tech. person such as myself, I found the camera very easy to use and was pleased with the many different shooting options.  The zoom is the best feature by far.  I was able to zoom in on my son's face as he watched the parade or I could set it to autoshoot and take several pictures in a row as he went around on the carousel or other circular rides.  Some of the pics came out blurry in this setting but there was always one good "keeper"!  Other things worth noting are the stabilized zoom (very nice), the large LCD screen, and how compact it is!  Although I wouldn't suggest carrying it in your pocket, it is slim enough to do so in a pinch.  And has the zoom capabilities of much more expensive and bulky cameras.Overall, I love this camera!  I hope to use it for many years to come!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Damenou
Reviews.Content: Just a small and yet effective camera that I enjoyed a lot. I got it on time and have been using it for a while with no problem. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera; a little bit slow
Reviews.Author: Guille I.
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera; Canon does not disappoint. From my experience, these are the best pictures (and zoom) you can get with such a compact camera.My only complaint is that it takes too long to save between picture and picture.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy This Camera.
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: I've owned two Canon cameras in the past, both which took great pictures and were your simple everyday point-and-shoot. I needed a new camera and this time, decided to go a little higher and buy the best point and shoot at the time. Boy, was I wrong. The camera takes great pictures, when you have light. The dark settings do nothing so any picture you take not under light comes out horrible. The 720p video is pix-elated and blurry, and I'm sure is not native 720p, because the picture is horrible. Not crisp or clear. And if you do manage to record a video you like, and want it on your computer, you'll probably end up with same problem I have and the video will be corrupted once its on your computer. I sent my camera in to Canon for repair since it was under warranty to see if they could fix the problem. The RMA said they replaced the motherboard, but when I got the camera back, I was still having the same problem. And for no reason after video recording for 20 minutes, the camera shuts off the record by itself and after recording for half an hour, the battery dies. I couldn't believe all the problems I had with this camera when I've only owned few cameras in my lifetime. Canon really disappointed me on this model, and if you want a good point-and-shoot with good video, DON'T BUY THIS.

Reviews.Title: good camera and good features.....actually price went up !!!
Reviews.Author: Jay Boppana
Reviews.Content: I have bought this product and I am pretty much impressed with its performance. You make use of the features and will definitely love this. I came back to buy the same product here and found that the price went up (it's doubled). Yes I have bought it for $200 and it prices about $400 now.

Reviews.Title: Extremely slow camera
Reviews.Author: Kyle "cylem"
Reviews.Content: Decided to try this out as an upgrade to my older Casio fh-100. I was looking for some more advanced features. Firstly, the popup flash is cool, but extremely annoying. I know most smaller cameras with pop up flash have this issue, but its definitely a minus in any case. Well compared to my casio, this thing is freakn slow, it takes a couple seconds to focus and shoot, then a couple seconds between shots. That doesn't take into account the time to charge flash or save if necessary. As well this also didn't have the best photo quality, comparing photos of the same thing i actually prefered my older, cheaper casio. The one thing i did really like were the functions of the camera, the scroll wheel on the back worked great to select things, the effects on the camera were great, and the manual settings worked well. Overall package i was disappointed and returned it, if you are looking for something thats a bit speedier definitely stay away.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: C. Schnitler "Avid reader"
Reviews.Content: I love my camera. I'm still learning some of its tricks so where I gave 4 stars, it may be me not the camera. I don't find it as intuitive to figure out as the Fuji I had, but the quality is much better. I bought it refurbished so that made it in my price range.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: TAMIKAWHITTED
Reviews.Content: So far this camera is very nice.  Still have some time to work with it though to get the full effect.  Very easy to use and the photos are wonderful so far.

Reviews.Title: Bad video
Reviews.Author: D. Chien
Reviews.Content: This is the third Canon point and shoot I've purchased because I was extremely pleased with the previous ones and I wanted one with more zoom.  Everything else works great except the autofocus which I depend on.  I ended up adjusting the shutter speed for pictures instead of using "auto".  The video constantly moves out of focus even though i'm trying to keep the camera steady and on target.  I know it is not a camcorder but all of my other digital cameras took adequate basic videos but this will not.  I'm disappointed because I wanted all the functions to be adequate in one package.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: TechieGirl
Reviews.Content: I wanted a point-and-shoot with a lot of additional features, and this camera is great. The only thing is that the shutter speed is a little slow, and it tends to produce blurry pictures if not shot with great precision. Otherwise, this camera is amazing because it has very artistic effects such as Color Accent. Not many cameras have this feature, and it is tough to even produce that effect on Photoshop because you have to do it manually. Color Accent makes this camera a win for me. :)

Reviews.Title: Fine camera
Reviews.Author: Bernard Nisenholz
