Reviews.Content: Takes great photos. Too many features to mention, and quite a learning curve to learn them all. However, one does not have to. The biggest drawback is the pop up flash which automatically pops up when the camera is turned on. Additionally, your finger easily gets in the way preventing the flash from popping up. This could eventually prevent use of the flash at all. The flash itself is not very powerful. If you can live with that, it is a wonderful compact camera with a great zoom for its size. For $200 (what I paid for it on Amazon)  it is a lot of camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS
Reviews.Author: woodrow
Reviews.Content: What a great little camera! So many features packed into such a small package! This is a great pocket camera with enough features to keep one occupied for a long time to come, and also produces great pictures. The low light feature is especially nice for taking pictures inside without the flash washing the background out. It's a very well rounded camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Clare
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I purchased this camera. The zoom is incredible, I love having the HD video. The features are as good as or better than my bigger camera. There are a few downsides, that are minor compared to how great the camera is. My biggest complaint is the battery/SD card door is very difficult to open, and the side door for the USB could provide better clearance for plugging it in. I never thought I'd get a zoom this good in a camera this small.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, Great photos
Reviews.Author: A. Barve "AJ"
Reviews.Content: I like the camera , the HD video but unline my Canon ISUS there is hardly any space ot hold this camera I feel. I think this camera has so many nice features that it is a good buy. Recommend for anyone who wants a compact warrior, the pictures are far superior to an IXUS model

Reviews.Title: soft images
Reviews.Author: Arizona Ed
Reviews.Content: Sent this back. Images too soft and only 2 f stops make landscapes even softer.Should be fine for most point and shooters printing only 4X6 prints.

Reviews.Title: Zoom Zoom
Reviews.Author: Goldfisch
Reviews.Content: This camera has a fantastic zoom, and takes great pictures both close and near. It is very easy to use and has on screen help to remind you what all those symbols mean. It's fast and light and the battery seems to last a long time.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera Great Price
Reviews.Author: Otter1
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter photo Class and it is great.  A very awesome product and she is using it all the time now.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: lmbouton
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this camera. Great features and definitely far more advanced than your other standard "pocket" cameras. It has several features that take a while to get used to but they are great when you do. THe quality of the photos is great as well! The battery life is good. I can take about 200 pictures before it starts to slow down which is quite impressive for the brightness of the flash and auto review and all of the features provided. The zoom is my favorite part by far. You can get great zoom and great quality as well, especially for such a small camera.I have yet to use the video aspect of the camera, however.Very happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX210...I love it!
Reviews.Author: Betty J. Welch "Betty J"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  This is the 5th Canon I have purchased from Amazon, and each one has been better than the last.  I was looking for a camera with these attributes:  - small enough to fit in my leather case to wear on my belt  - capable of quality photos in low light  - longer distance flash  - easy video control...the instant button is very handy.  - greater zoom distance...amazing for such a small camera!This camera fulfills all my requirements.  I just came back from a vacation in Michigan, and the photos I took are absolutely gorgeous.  I found I could leave the camera set on "Auto" almost all of the time.  The only time I found myself switching to "Manual" was when I wanted to force the flash.  Otherwise, "Auto" works great.My only negative comment concerns the placement of the pop-up flash.  Since I (and most people) hold a camera in two hands, I found my left index finger tends to cover the flash, so it doesn't pop up when I turn the camera on.  However, I've learned to adjust, and am very pleased with everything else.

Reviews.Title: I need more time to learn how to use it
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera right before going on vacation to SC and only used it on the AUTO setting.  The night photos did not come out, but the video capture was quite good.  I am anxious to read the manual and try different settings.

Reviews.Title: I really nice camera!
Reviews.Author: Mickey
Reviews.Content: I've bought this camera to take to my daughter's pageant. My old camera had a terrible zoom (3x) and it didn't take clear videos because the pixels were too low (4 megapixels). This camera has a 14x zoom that I absolutely love and the pixels (14.1 megapixels) look great on my 47" HD LCD TV. It is also a great camera for someone who doesn't know a lot about cameras because it has a feature that lets you point and shoot where the camera will make all the adjustments that you need. It actually has two options for this EASY and AUTO. You can choose which one works best for you. I personally have used both depending on whether I'm inside or outside. I have recommended this camera to two people already and they told me that they were going to look into it. Also, when I went to purchase this camera at a local store like Walmart, Target, and Best Buy, in two different states, they either didn't carry the camera or they were out of stock. I found it a challenge then and had to have the camera, because I figured it must be a great camera and it is!

Reviews.Title: Overexposed photos, hard to focus
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Nichols
Reviews.Content: This camera at times takes great photos...but I have run into the lens shadow problem. A bigger problem is that it does not focus well...fuzzy often, and photos are overexposed a lot. It's my least favorite Canon and I've owned a lot of them. I don't recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great everyday camera
Reviews.Author: Lucy Ajdaharian
Reviews.Content: This camera is great, its zoom ability is awesome, the features are really fun to play around with, and overall, it's great for everyday use.  It's not the most compact or lightest, but the slightly larger size and weight are worth it for the increased quality of the photos.  The only thing I don't like is how the flash is on the left side, and pops up when taking the picture--so when holding the camera, if my hand happens to be holding that part, then the flash won't open at all.  I have noticed this on some other great Canon cameras as well.  But, if the flash is actually open, it works great, captures enough light.  I am very pleased with my purchase.  I LOVE Canon cameras; from my experience, they have the perfect balance of quality and user-friendliness.

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Calguy
Reviews.Content: This little camera can get the pictures you want with just a little work ,not hard. Could pay more but why? This is all you need for the average person.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: llwyd
Reviews.Content: excelant camera,on and off switch a little small 4 mens hands ,but does excelant job,small enough to put in your pocket,so no need to carry it in a bag

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price
Reviews.Author: Robert F. Bua
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for the price, and I'd recommend it to a friend. There are newer models of this camera; however, getting this one saves about $150-$175 over the newer ones. As cameras go, I think you usually get more "bang for the buck" by purchasing an older one, then as you budget permitsCanon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 14x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black) buying a newer model but not the newest model.

Reviews.Title: great camera for novice and semi-pro
Reviews.Author: Cathrin Eckle
Reviews.Content: I  received the camera for Fathers day and I am very pleased so far with the many options available and most of all I am able to shoot pictures on auto or easy without thinking about settings etc.  However being able to manually adjust most settings allow me to learn and acquire skill as a hobby photographer.

Reviews.Title: canon sx 210 is
Reviews.Author: britz
Reviews.Content: The canon sx 210is  is a great camera for the price.  Lots of good features and great quality photos and esp video.  The zoom is slow.  Had to get used to that.  Overall good product and I have recommended it to a number of people looking for a small pocket camera with a larger zoom feature.

Reviews.Title: Amazon presentation
Reviews.Author: Mr Lee
Reviews.Content: The camera is all that the reviews said it would be.My only negative comment is that the product descriptiondoes not list what comes in the camera package. I ordereda separate battery charger, only to find out a charger camein the camera package. It would be helpful if the Amazondescription of the product would list what comes with the item.

Reviews.Title: My 6th Canon Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: Another excellent Canon Point&Shoot.;  I love the optical zoom and image quality kicked out of this little camera.  The only downside is the LCD screen on the back is not the best.  I would opt for more pixels, so I can see the extreme details of my photos.  All and all, I'm satisfied with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Compact Camera with 14x Zoom
Reviews.Author: JohnHancock
Reviews.Content: I bought this last month. I haven't explored all the features and settings yet. I've only used the Auto settings to take most pictures and the Video setting. I am impressed with the image quality and zoom capabilities in particular. I have taken pictures of things I couldn't see with the naked eye and the camera has captured those with precision.Video is great quality for a compact and the microphone works well too.All in all, a good buy for a compact camera that fits your pocket and your budget.Yea, as pointed before flash position is weird but you get used to it if you don't own 10 cameras :-)

Reviews.Title: The best choice
Reviews.Author: Abe
Reviews.Content: I like this camera. It takes great photos and its optical zoom really good comparing with its small size. Canon powershot sx210is takes a very good quality pictures even if are taken from a far distance, the image stabilization really works well. Also, it's cheap comparing with the features wich it has. Definetly this camera is the best choice.

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera
Reviews.Author: E. Klett
Reviews.Content: This is a decent camera. Not the best I've owned but not the worst either. I dig the screen on the back but I'm not a fan of the flash. It is small and fits in my pocket so that's nice. All in all, for the price, it's good.

Reviews.Title: Value for Money Digital camera
Reviews.Author: msvg
Reviews.Content: Hi all,I ordered this camera a week before and i got it delivered within 2 days .Its an awesome value for money camera.Its sturdy,heavy ,light on pocket camera.The picture quality is very good and neat. Its a good travellers compact camera.I am yet to explore more features in the camera as its got a hell a lot of them.Highly recommended for personal and gifting purpose.Happy clickingMSVG

Reviews.Title: AMAZING PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Although I have not tested the samera in all situations yet I have high expectations from what I have seen so far.  This camera is as good as it gets withought going to an SLR or professional camera.  It has taken great pictures in average light settings and the white ballance is good.  There is an issue with the barrel of the lense casting a shadow in certain instances (i have tested this and seen an internet demo before i bought the camera and was aware that this was an issue), but i am willing to live with it, or set the camera to widescreen to "auto-crop" it out.  Pictures look great so far, an amazing amount of features and many that I have not even tested yet!  I am looking forward to using this for all my photography needs.THANKS CANON!

Reviews.Title: good for video; photos in zoom look soft
Reviews.Author: Vijay
Reviews.Content: im a avid dslr user. use P&S; also for travel.great video. from a pic stand point, it is slow, recharge between pics is slow; also at 14x, the shake is quite visible. and the pictures are quite soft.there are options like Aperture, program.... but because of the sluggishness is snaping a shot, they are of not much use. I was forced to move to auto mode.i just posted it on ebay for sale.

Reviews.Title: Excellent macro and low-light performance
Reviews.Author: CGScammell
Reviews.Content: I bought this Canon in the fall of 2010 to replace my beloved Canon S90 that had suffered some water damage after I fell into a rushing creek during a backpacking adventure along the John Muir Trail.  Although this camera is no S90, it has a few outstanding qualities of its own unlike the S90.I have several small Canon point and shoots and this one exceeds all the others when it comes to macro shots.  It consistently gets the closest, best-focused shots when compared to the S90.  Although the flash sometimes wants to activate, it can eventually focus on demand.I have also taken excellent shots of the moon during several full moon rises.Two things that weigh against the camera are its slow shutter release and the added weight.  This weighs almost twice as much as my S90.  And the shutter release and auto focus can take a few seconds to activate, which can create blurry photographs or badly-composed shots of running pets or children.Image quality is excellent though.  So if you are looking for an excellent macro camera, a decent video recorder and shots of and low-light landscapes or portraits, this is an excellent camera despite the incremental price increase of almost a hundred bucks since I bought this camera.  It's an excellent alternative to other cameras.PRO:MacroLow-LightImage qualityCON:WeightSlow shutter releaseSlow flash

Reviews.Title: Great Companion Walk Around Camera
Reviews.Author: WWJDwithCA
Reviews.Content: I personally really enjoy photography, and I like to use professional level equipment.  I'm not talking about a having a digital SLR kit either, I'm talking about high quality professional glass, so when I go out shooting I take it very seriously.  But as most people who enjoy semi-professional photography they don't enjoy lugging the equipment, and this Canon Powershot really is a nice addition to my equipment inventory that has really brought some joy to my overall experience.  The macro images are really quite excellent, the landscape images are very good, and the ability to zoom in tight is really quite amazing.  I find that I can actually take many pictures that I don't miss my SLR.  Then there's the 720p video with a very good built-in condenser microphone.I like the adjustments and flexibility of the camera.  You can easily over-ride the flash to fill, you can change the color settings fairly easy before shooting a video, and when changing color and white balance settings you immediately see your changes in the screen.  You really just need to spend about a 1/2 hour messing with the device to figure out how it worked.  Maybe it was an hour, anyway it wasn't difficult, and I didn't have to sit and read the manual.  If you don't know photography you will need to read it, but otherwise you'll be fine.  The function wheel is pretty cool, lightly touch the wheel in any of the four corners and macro, exposure adjustments, flash control, and timer pop onto the screen, so you can make quick adjustments  without going thru the menus.The video quality is not on the level of the still image quality, and I was not able to figure out how to switch to manual focus shooting videos, but overall they are pretty good, 4/5.  Still images don't give you the option of a raw format, jpg only, so 14 MP is desirable with JPG compression.Overall, amazingly awesome all around still and video camera that I can carry in my pants pocket!

Reviews.Title: CANNON SX 210
Reviews.Author: Douglas S. Ercey "DOUGE"
Reviews.Content: REALLY EASY TO USE. TAKES GREAT PICS AND GREAT COLORATION AND SATURATION. THEY PRINT OUT GREAT AND VIVID. A GREAT BUY.Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 14x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: momof400
Reviews.Content: My teenager loved this camera.  it is easy to use, produces great photos, and very fashionable.  The color is even better and brighter in person.  Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: GUIDE BOOK HELP
Reviews.Author: Gordon Schmierer "Gordon"
Reviews.Content: I've used digital camera before so I knew pretty much what to expect.  However, I found the handbook/guide very basic.  For a fast start, more detailed "Helps" would have made by new camera more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: Nice point and shoot camera.  Zoom is fine, but it's no SLR.
Reviews.Author: Bob "Bob"
Reviews.Content: Please see Cooper's Hawk picture above.  I like this camera because it has 14x optical zoom, which is great for zooming in on people, but not so great for difficult wildlife pictures.  I was hoping I might be able to take this camera backpacking and leave my SLR behind to save weight.  The key question was whether the zoom was good enough to take the pictures I wanted of wildlife (including birds) that I see when I'm hiking in the National Parks.  From my house (open window), I first took a picture with the Powershot SX210IS of a cooper's hawk way in the back of my yard at maximum 14x optical (not digital) zoom (on left).  I then pulled out my Canon XSI SLR with 70-300 mm lens and took the same shot (see right picture).  Both were outside the typical range of the lens, and both had similar megapixels and file size; however, you can tell the left picture is not near the quality of the right picture.  As I said, I like the camera, but you might want to temper your expectations.  It's great for people, but not a replacement for a real zoom lens for wildlife photography.By the way, I have no problem with the pop up zoom.  I like the option of opening and closing the flash with my finger to suit my needs.  The video is nice, but note that you cannot play it on your computer because it's high def.  If you try, you get jerky movement.  The video is fine when played on my HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera (just not for me)
Reviews.Author: KayakGirl
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to use in a beginner digital photography class.  I hadn't decided whether I wanted to by a dslr yet and I thought the manual controls on this camera would allow me to learn photography without making a huge financial investment.  It was a great little camera with an awesome zoom lens.  The flash is in an awkward place right uner your left index finger, but I think you would get used to that after a short while.  In the end I decided to return this camera.  I found that although it did have full manual controls, a lot of the functions were located within the camera menus.  It was very time consuming to have to go through the menu to change the aperture, shutter speed and ISO while trying to get a shot.  I ended up borrowing a Canon G9 from my brother that is older with less zoom on the lens, but all the manual controls are located on the outside of the camera via a dial or button.As far as ordering through Amazon, it was an excellent experience as always.  They had a great price on the camera and it arrived very quickly.  I went through the online return center and dropped the camera off at a UPS location on a Monday.  By Tuesday they had the package back and my refund was processed within a day or two.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Kiko
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's a great travel digital camera. While it weighs more than I'd like, the features and performance are pretty amazing. My only frustration is the flash is a little slow when trying to take a quick picture. Sometimes it goes as planned with no issues and then there are those times when the flash doesn't work and the picture doesn't turn out as well. The video feature is beautiful and it turns out with enough light and sound quality that rivals my video camera.The PowerShot does take some great pictures in low or no light that is really impressive. I'm hoping that it's just a learning curve with the flash problems I've had using it and my pictures will just get better as I play more with the pictures.Amazon had the price of the PowerShot about $50 less than the electronic stores and what my credit card was offering using my points. It's a great deal and I am pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS
Reviews.Author: jankay39
Reviews.Content: Still have tons to learn in the operation of this camera but so far It is the most liked camera I own.  Once I am more aquainted with the operation, It probably be my only choice. The only problem I have at the moment is I keep putting my finger on the flash door and inhibit it's opening. This is a small design flaw worth getting used to for a camera of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: new camera
Reviews.Author: croftondre
Reviews.Content: This camera was a Christmas present for my wife. She did the research and told me which model to get. She loves it and is very happy. One thing I would recomend. Get the wireless memory card for any camera you get.

Reviews.Title: Stop here and buy this point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Mostafa Sheta "dude"

} cv_moS6BWEGPE4JIUloadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_moS6BWEGPE4JIUloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_moS6BWEGPE4JIUloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion);
