} } } Length:: 7:55 MinsFor the most part this is the best Camera thats not SLR on the market, with a few flaws, but more features to offset it's flaws accept no other digital camera.

Reviews.Title: BEST compact zoom camera EVER!
Reviews.Author: B. Elisano "KyBird Reader"
Reviews.Content: Buy this camera, you will not be disappointed. I bought one for myself and my boyfriend for Christmas so I haven't used it much but I took some sunrise pictures on New Year's Day over the Atlantic city skyline and WOW, I never thought a small camera could capture such gorgeous shots, my facebook pages were all a buzz over the pictures. I am by no means a professional photographer but my pictures so far, make me look like I am. I look forward to learning more so that I can maximize the capabilities with this great camera. I can't say enough good things about it, the flash comes up when it needs to and goes back down by itself, it is very user friendly for even the novice photographer. 5 stars all around!!!

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Deborah
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. I think for the money it is a great value. The zoom is perfect and is great but it still is small enough to carry with you.

Reviews.Title: great camera w/ recalcitrant flash.
Reviews.Author: Norman M. Kaminsky
Reviews.Content: Having to maually raise flash id a nuisance, but the camera is excellent. Autofocus is goog, but sometimes slow. Al else A-OK.

Reviews.Title: Bala
Reviews.Author: Bala
Reviews.Content: This is an excellant camera with number of useful features. It was a gift to my wife and she liked it very much.

Reviews.Title: PowerShot SX210IS
Reviews.Author: jaman51
Reviews.Content: I like the size, weight and ease of use, but the pictures aren't as clear as the Fuji 3.5 megapixel camera that this one replaces. I might need to learn more about the setup or preperation for the picture, but so far, I like the Fuji picture quality better.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX210is
Reviews.Author: marzancastro
Reviews.Content: Great camera, easy to use and excellent zoom and picture quality. The only problem with this camera is the pop-up zoom that's positioned in the upper-left part of the camera and interferes while grabbing it.

Reviews.Title: Best camera i ever had
Reviews.Author: terminatorf1000 "Fer"
Reviews.Content: Simply the best camera I ever had... And the brand is the best, Canon products are strong, nothing can brake it... 14x optical zoom is really wonderful... I love my new camera...

Reviews.Title: Great intermediate level point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Betsy H Orman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 18 year old daughter who was traveling to Africa and throughout the US on a missions trip. This is her third point and shoot having worn out a Lumix and a Casio both having broken within a year. She wanted a SLR but I knew she wouldnt be able to shelp it around in her backpack so I looked for the highest end point and shoot that had the clearest pictures and HD video capacity, as well as low light ability. This camera had it all. I heard from her by phone that this is the best camera she ever owned, the pictures are crystal clear, easy to use, has all the stuff she loves, fisheye, low light and zoom. She could take shots of flowers with the dew drops on them as well as Sunsets with equal quality. She said, after begging us for a heavy big SLR, that she was so happy with the quality of this camera and this was providing amazing clarity for the size. I also bought another Lumix top of the line point and shoot for her twin brother who is now traveling in Europe. I noticed his shots are not as clear, however it may be how he transfers them to Facebook. They are fuzzy and look grainy which is surprising also for Lumix but they are no longer using the Leica lenses on the lower end models.I researched every camera out there, all the specs, all the reviews, and bought her lots of memory as she will be doing the video magazine for the organization she is traveling with. I think if you are frustrated with the limitations of a point and shoot and need the next level of camera this is really the one to choose. Also I got an open box camera on Amazon for much cheaper than the regular retail. It was in perfect condition, so it really made the deal worth it. My sister also has a Cannon camera and sends me beautifully clear pictures as well from France, that she downloads to my email and look great as well. Also my daughter choose the gold color and thought that and purple were so snazzy, and you know with a teenager its all about the look! I know this is one graduation present she will never forget and I just hope it lasts.

Reviews.Title: what's up with the un-sharp details?
Reviews.Author: b
Reviews.Content: I'm editing this review again, now that I've had it for several months.I bought this to replace my Canon SD600. I do LOVE the zoom lens, it's the only reason why I am going to hang on to this camera. the wide angle is nice to have too. but more and more, I have been choosing to bring my SD600 with me since it is smaller and in many ways, better. two reasons why:1. for the SX210IS, consistency is unreliable. sometimes I get amazing photos, sometimes they are bad-- blurry (even when I'm using a tripod), too dark, too light, etc. when I get a good photo, it is awesome. but for the most part I feel like I could trust the SD600 more.2. image detail when viewing @ 100% on my computer--- as a test, I shot several photos on auto mode in my living room, focusing on a painting that was about 8 feet away from me. There was plenty of light. on my computer, I zoomed in at 100% and compared the sd600 and sx210 photos side by side. the details of the painting were much sharper on the old sd600 every time-- with or without flash. (note: images were in focus and my hand was steady.) I heard this is an issue with many of the new compact cameras. companies are trying to pack in as many megapixels as possible, but the sensors are not good enough. megapixels don't matter if the sensor sucks.

Reviews.Title: over priced for what you get
Reviews.Author: DD "DD"
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to get this camera until I used it.  My husband bought it because our Olympus wasn't quick enough to catch our toddler on the go.  This camera snapped the shot but no matter which setting it was on, it was blurry.  The Olympus was much clearer.  Also, the flash is in an awkward place.  I'm so use to putting my finger on the top that I stopped it from automatically popping up every time.  I returned it after trying for a week.

Reviews.Title: SX210IS
Reviews.Author: Canon Fan
Reviews.Content: Overall great camera.  However, seems to have a problem finding focus, especially if there is slight movement and with inside photos.  After buying the camera, I went on a trip during which time I took about 150 photos.  About 20% came out a bit blurry or seemed slightly out of focus (about 10% was caused by movement).  Also, unlike with SLR's (or DSLR's), does not work well with depth perception.

Reviews.Title: great if zoom wasn't poorly made
Reviews.Author: Stefanie "stuffy9911"
Reviews.Content: I have owed this camera for about 2 years.  After regular wear and tear, the telescoping lens has decided to get stuck in an open position.  It seems to be due to the fact that the lens comes out extremely far.  When it retracts back in, it brings any lint, dust or dirt with it.  You can hear the lens trying to retract but it sounds like a piece of sand is stuck in it (you hear the crunching noise it makes).  The camera definitely needs a better dust skirt around the telescoping mechanism.  If you plan to only take pictures in your house it may be fine, but don't plan for camera to last too long in real world.

Reviews.Title: Seriously Unhappy
Reviews.Author: Harold
Reviews.Content: A bit of background:  I am a reasonably serious photographer, and I normally shoot with a Nikon DSLR.  I bought this camera when I was looking for a lightweight camera that I could use indoors and outdoors.  I also expected it to take reasonable movies indoors and outdoors.I've had the camera for more than a year, and all I can say about it is that I am seriously unhappy with it.  It does take reasonable still pictures outdoors, and that's about it.  I find the indoor performance for still pictures to be poor, and I find the movie performance to be poor both indoors and outdoors.  In movie mode, the camera is unable to find and maintain focus, and indoor exposure in settings such as concerts is positively abysmal.I'd summarize my feelings by saying that I totally regret my purchase, and wish I had looked some more before buying.  I REALLY DISLIKE THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: "Yellow" indoor shots
Reviews.Author: Vicky
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for well over a year now.  I hate it.  It is so unreliable.  Indoor shots have a yellow cast to them no matter what conditions exist.  I have tried several settings to shoot with and they all come out poorly.  I have to edit every picture I take.  The focus is slow as well.  Outdoor shots are great, but I mostly use it indoors.  I am switching back to a Nikon.  I only bought this camera because it had high ratings.  I really don't know why.

Reviews.Title: camera is ok
Reviews.Author: omar
Reviews.Content: the camera in general is a good camera and i like most of the pictures i take with it however, the cons are that in door pics or low light pictures and video are terrible with this camera. the other bad thing about this camera is that the battery runs out pretty quickly. this cam does have a lot of options but im not a pro and dont know what adjustments to make i mostly use the auto function, sport function and night function

Reviews.Title: Features cannot make up for Poor Image Quality
Reviews.Content: The features are great, as well as the small form-factor. However, the image quality is just appalling. The sensor is noisy (despite the 14 megapixels, which is a joke!) and the optics are poor. Not recommended at any price point, because the pictures should go to trash.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: anne
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera with excellent zoom and photos. It's quite complicated unfortunately to find information because the user guide is online and is very long to print. I needed information quickly that I had to go online to look up. Too bad they don't include the guide with the camera

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: BetC
Reviews.Content: This camera is great especially when you consider the reasonable price. The zoom is amazing for a small digital camera so you can get up close from far away without being conspicuous. Such a plus when traveling in foreign countries when a fixed zoom lense screams tourist and paints a target on your back with pickpockets. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I wanted to upgrade my camera to one with a good zoom ability. This camera is great. I love the ease of use. I love the size and weight. And I even love the purple color. I think it is a great camera for the money. Would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Totally Enamored !!! Totally Happy !!! Totally taken aback !!!
Reviews.Author: Matthew J. Molina Jr.
Reviews.Content: I've owned many cameras in over four decades ,,, all sophisticated analog & digital [no camera-for-dummies here] ,,, but this digital camera takes-the-cake!This Camera comes with an awesome state-of-the-art Canon Lens ,,, accompanied by a dynamite supporting cast ,,, body, controls & auto functions ,,, and features too many to mention here, Examples: friendly user interface; easy to understand & use controls; 2-speed 14x zoom; mind-boggling steady jitter-free video; on-screen intelligible helpful icons & brief helpful text; unbelievably-fast light/dark auto-adjust; AI [artificial-intelligence] finds faces and things, shows where focused; ,,, hidden/convenient connectors [HDMI]; ,,, ingenious hidden flash "door" operates manually [& automatically]; ,,, GLASS LCD display; ,,, Non-verbose Operator Manual.Of course ,,, it eats batteries ,,, Lithium-ion ,,, Re-Charges in 2 hours ,,, Bought Spare Battery [keep in pouch].  --  Although I did not "time" the battery-life, it did last days,Days,DAYS of playing with it !!!  --  No complaint here !!! ,,, Totally satisfied !!!Operator Panel / User Interface / Computer Controls ,,, are MOST Excellent, well thought-out, few buttons, multi-functional. A vast improvement over the "PowerShot" series of Canon Digital Cameras ,,, much more AI "artificial intelligence" [awesome].For Protection and Convenience:1- Purchased "Canon" Lithium-ion Spare Battery [not OEM].2- Purchased "Case Logic" pouch, the Canon fits great inside and it has a pocket for Spare Battery, etc. [inexpensive].3- Purchased "LCD Screen Protector", easy to install, works great [inexpensive].Sincerely ,,, I have No Complaint !!!Matthew

Reviews.Title: Great zoom, but disappointing low light pics...
Reviews.Author: A. L. Zangl
Reviews.Content: I was hoping this camera would be a great family camera with enough zoom to make my husband happy, small, but still take decent pictures indoors.  The white balance is better than the Canon SX110 I owned previously, but unless the subject is motionless the pictures turn out blurry.  I hate using flash.  To me that ruins a picture.  So for outdoor pictures and even indoor with good lighting the pictures are beautiful.  In medium-low to low light the pictures are mostly junk.I already own a DSLR and won't sacrifice quality, but really wanted something less bulky to lug around.  So now I bit the bullet and ordered the Canon S95 which I am extremely excited to get, but unfortunately it is backordered until who knows when.  I guess the moral of the story is, for this size camera you have to choose between getting zoom or getting a good low-light shooter.  Or like me, you end up buying two cameras!

Reviews.Title: 5 Stars if you got it under $200, which I did!
Reviews.Author: Jee-E
Reviews.Content: Zoom +: 14x OPTICAL zoom! OPTICAL OPTICAL OPTICAL!Diaphragm +: 1:3.1-5.9. A very important technical detail that normally got ignored. This one is great with it's 14x optical zoom, which enhances the capability of movement capture and picture quality.Flash +: good performance.Video +: Nice sound and picture quality. Not enough to work as a movie material, but its largest setting is OK for a 1080p TV, and smallest setting is good enough on YouTube.Focus Speed -: a little bit slow. You would think you are able to catch a great movement picture for its diaphragm, but NOOOOO. The auto-focus speed is slow - in my case, no pictures of a dolphin with any parts above the blue sea, but pretty good pictures of its whole body underneath a moving surface. :(Ease of Use -: If you are for the "ease-of-use" of a camera, you might have to reconsider. To compromise its well-designed 14x opt-zoom, diaphragm and flash, the company squish the flash to the corner so it is not very comfortable to hold on the left. Meanwhile, the panel buttons on the back give up their sizes and signs for the large LCD screen, which might make someone have to "guess" if new to a Canon.Overall, 5 star if you can get it under $200, and is still highly recommended within $250.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera!!
Reviews.Author: liz98
Reviews.Content: I have a very nice SLR for getting the good shots, but did not want to risk breaking or losing it on a trip to Africa. So I bought this little gem for my safaris and it did not disappoint. I brought home amazing photos and it was so easy to travel with. Fits in your pocket and the battery lasted quite a while. I only had to change out the battery once on an all day safari and I used my camera constantly. Unless you have a steady hand the pictures can start to get a little fuzzy after about 25x or so zoom, but the 14x zoom pics were stunning. The auto settings worked quite well for sunsets and other low light situations indoors as well. I think this camera has now replaced my SLR as the favorite. Don't even question whether this is a good buy and just get one.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX210is Review
Reviews.Author: Ganti
Reviews.Content: The best part of this camera is it has a wonderful display. The interface is very good, navigating wheel on the right bottom corner is very useful. The picture quality in broad day light is amazing but night shots are okay. Any slight movement of the camera in  the night mode will blur the image. Specially many might be reluctant to take gold one but i bet its 1000 times better looking that the black one. My friend and me bought around the same time he got black and i gold, he still feels bad for his choice. The battery life is pretty good. I would say its worth for the money.

Reviews.Title: Good thing in Carhartt-side-pocket-sized package
Reviews.Author: jtvt "Justin"
Reviews.Content: This is the best quality you will find in this price range, and for a ways above. One smart camera! Very quick focusing, motion shots are usually no trouble, and more features than this amateur reviewer will ever use...Really digging the easy controls when using program/manual modes, intuitive design makes it easy to adjust ISO and focus as well if you so desire. The piece that is usually a fixed four-way button on most cameras doubles as a dial here. Think Ipod style.And that zoom, ahhh. A little more speed wouldn't hurt, but it is amazingly clear up to the 56x digital max, able to read a bar code way across the room without leaving your chair. Surely there are more practical applications for that as well, but I didn't want to leave the chair to find them.Video was the only sore spot. Doesn't look like HD at all, and even worse in low light. Sort of makes up for it with excellent (point and shoot curve grading) audio quality. But with the size of that lens, there's only so much they can squeeze into the package! Very pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Canon has a winner here
Reviews.Author: Okonski
Reviews.Content: I  Recently went on a hiking trip and took photos of some mountain sides on the night setting with a nice moon - photos turned out suprisingly well and I love the 14 megapixel resolution!. I definitely recommend this camera!  I previously had an older Canon Digital pwoershot with a much lower resolution and it worked great for a while, but I was in search of a larger higher resolution photos.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX210S
Reviews.Author: sam181
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA IS UNBELIEVEABLE, The zoom will blow your mind away for a camera this compact. The picture quality is Great.Over all this camera is the best compact camera in my opinion on the market.Price is cost effective. Great buy

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: vger
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but love for this camera! The quality is phenomenal!  The zoom is crazy!!! Love it all!

Reviews.Title: Packed Little Camera
Reviews.Author: JHolt
Reviews.Content: Pros: We bought this camera because it was rated the best compact digital camera on [...] for under $300, and we haven't been disappointed.  The optical zoom is great, especially for the price. I'm a casual point-and-shoot photographer, but I think the image and video quality is amazing, so much better than our old camera. Haven't figured out all its features yet. Dense little guy, feels sturdy.Cons: There is slight motor noise when zooming during video capture, but much better than the digital camera it replaced. The battery has to be removed to be charged in the wall charger it comes with. Would be convenient if you could recharge it through the USB, but you can't, so consider buying an extra battery to swap in and out. I've seen some new cameras now with onscreen touch menus. This one doesn't have that, nor a view finder.Notes:  Make sure you get the right SDHC flash memory card (with HC on the end) so you won't have problems recording video. We found a good deal on the Transcend 8 GB Class 6 (class is related to its transfer speed) SDHC, model TS8GSDHC6E.

Reviews.Title: Canon power shot SX210IS
Reviews.Author: Frank "FJC"
Reviews.Content: Great camera, bought for an Alaska trip very pleased with all pictures taken inserted a 16G card shot over 600 pictures with out a problem. 14X wide angle was super. highly recommend this Canon camera

Reviews.Title: I am loyal to Canon, but returned this camera
Reviews.Author: Rita Star
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera as a replacement for another Canon camera I had that was stolen. I returned it after using it for 1 night at an outdoor concert. Most of the pictures turned out fine, but so many were blurry and had to be retaken with super steady hands. The zoom is amazing, but zooming that far doesn't make a difference is the pic is blurry. Also, the pop up flash bothered me. I am sure this camera would be fine for someone with more time to dedicate to learning it, but I have used easier and more reliable point and shoots. Recently I bought the Canon waterproof camera and that took easy and all good pictures plus it is waterproof...

Reviews.Title: not live up to my expectation
Reviews.Author: Shinyee Siek
Reviews.Content: I was excited about this camera after reading all those positive reviews about it on amazon and before i bought it. finally after i received and used it for 5 days, i was pretty disappointed. the face recognition only works on certain modes, and doesn't work in AV and TV and program modes. for AV and TV modes, it only can be focus on the center, and you have to recompose it after focusing. so that means the focus can be off sometimes, depends on how far the focus is off the center after recomposing. i use AV a lot for my older canon camera, so this is a big blow for me. so i shifts to auto mode. when i use auto mode, the flash fired off a lot, which kills a lot of my indoor pictures. i hates flash. to me the auto mode is not that "smart", or i don't like the result of the photos i took with the auto mode. sometimes the depth of field is not what i want. low light mode work pretty well (i think it can only focus on center too). but you have to dig into the menu to select it.when you get a memory card, please get a "class 6" or higher. bigger video files will not be able to download to your computer if it is lower than class 6. for video shot, if the subject is moving a lot, the camera's focus sometimes will be soft and focus, soft and focus as it tries to look for the face of the subject that is moving. so this is not good either.all things consider, i am thinking about returning this camera. i like panasonic lumiz FZ-35 better. at least it doesn't have the focusing issue.

Reviews.Title: This camera is absolutely  horrible
Reviews.Author: Atlcharm
Reviews.Content: Why is there such a learning curve with a point and shoot camera?!  Granted the extra/advanced options are nice, but if I just want to take a simple picture I should be able to without putting much thought into it.  It is a total hit or miss on whether or not you will get a good photo with this camera.  Most of the images are grainy when you zoom in or too dark.  Forget about taking a picture in low light conditions, absolutely horrible.  My Sony Cybershot DSC-T10 takes much better pictures, the only reason I upgraded was for the super zoom, but it absolutely was a mistake.  Oh and this camera is an ergonomic fail!  The dial to change settings is absolutely horrible.  I have small fingers, so I wonder how those with large fingers work with that dial.  I've had this camera for a while now so it can't be returned.  I'll have to sell on ebay and take a loss.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: A. Ehrlich
Reviews.Content: This camera came with a warning that colors might not be true. They were correct. I cannot get any true color of nature. I am going back to my 10 year old Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as expected
Reviews.Author: cloudybook
Reviews.Content: I thought a camera with 14.1 MP, 14X optical zoom and so many features would be the perfect compact camera for my travels. However, I was greatly disappointed after trying it out. What I disliked about the camera:1) The flash was located at a location where it would distract your focus and hinder you; you can't even hold the camera properly when the flash is up. As a result, you get fingerprints all over the LCD screen. It's also very frustrating to use the flash; sometimes instead of a push of a button, you have to manually flip up the flash for the "flash on" function to work.2) The camera has many features and they are all cramped into this compact camera. As a result, sometimes you have to go through several steps to get to the function you want and the manual is not going to help you much. It's not a user friendly camera.3)The image quality is not good. You really have to stand very, very still for the pictures to come out okay. Most of the pictures look fine while viewed on the camera LCD, but once loaded into the computer or printed, they look blurry.I was looking forward to a compact camera with high optical zoom and can take good pictures in low light situations, but this is not it. I ended up returning it for a refund.

Reviews.Title: What a disappointment!!
Reviews.Author: Lisa Williams "Glitchy"
Reviews.Content: In fairness, I didn't spend a lot of time messing with settings on this camera before deciding to return it, but I own a Panasonic Lumix 12mp 12X zoom and bought this for my mother because it was 14mp and 14x zoom so I figured it was the next generation in point and shoot cameras and Canon is a trusted name. This might be a perfectly good camera for an average or novice user (hence the high amount of positive reviews) but for the price, I feel there are better cameras out there.Immediately I was disappointed by the image quality. The color calibration was way off right out of the box (blues looked purple and you don't even want to know how skin-tone looked)and not only that, but the display screen was somewhat pixelated making it difficult to decipher whether or not the picture itself was any good or not.The flash pops up on the top left corner which is an awkward place for a flash because your hand would be there to hold the camera, so I kept accidentally covering the flash or pushing it down. I don't know why they didn't build the flash into the body of the camera instead of making it a pop up. I can see that falling off or breaking easily down the road.The controls are clunky and awkward too. This camera was meant to replace a Canon Powershot SD6300 and even that camera had a clear LCD screen and button controls. You would think a newer generation model would have refined those things instead of making them less usable. I'm shocked and disappointed with the quality of this camera. Epic fail Canon!! I think I'll buy my mom the Lumix. I've had mine for a year and I'm still impressed by it every time I use it!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX210 IS Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Vishal
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SX210 IS is one of the best "point and shoot" camera. Super cool to use.Zoom can go upto 56X (14X Optical with 4X digital zoom).Good picture quality 14.1 MPixel.Integrated Optical Lens.and many more features....5/5 rating overall.Go for it.

Reviews.Title: Haven't tried it long enough to have a better opinion, but...
Reviews.Author: Beebo
Reviews.Content: So far I've had mixed reactions to the pictures I've shot.  Perhaps I am not using the camera correctly, and when I get a few spare minutes (which isn't often) I will read the manual.  In the interim, as I stated, I've had some mixed reactions.First reaction is that the close up shooting on this camera is below par, at least in the auto and easy modes (haven't taken enough time to learn the manual, AV and TV mode yet. Call me old school, but the thought of how some of these modes are digitalized and basically a computer version of reality makes me miss my 35mm.  But, I digress).  I've tried to zoom in even moderately on objects that are close to me (1-2 feet) and am incredibly disappointed at this camera's lack of ability to auto zoom on what I'm going for.  Perhaps I'm doing something wrong, and if anyone has any thoughts or recommendations, please let me know.  B/c I'm definitely not happy with this feature.Second reaction is a simple one.  As a father and soon to be husband, I carry the camera in my pocket with me quite a bit.  I'm extremely, extremely disappointed with the two "eyelids" that protect the lens of this camera.  I'm surprised that no other review I've read has noted the issue that I'm having - maybe something in my camera is broken?  Anyway, the "eyelids" (for lack of a more technical term) come open quite easily in my pocket, which would seem to me to open this camera lense up to a pretty significant amount of scratching and other damage. Why don't these lock in place when the camera is off?  One of the first thoughts I had after buying the camera is "I'm going to need a slim case or lens cap if I'm going to keep this in my pocket very often".Third reaction is that the zoom and longer distance pictures seem to be excellent so far.  I'm very pleased, having used some longer and larger zoom lenses on my 35mm, with how well this camera zooms for a pocket sized point and shoot.Next - there is definitely a delay when trying to take shots.  Kids and pets is mixed - sometimes it captures pictures incredibly fast (esp w/no flash) and others, it's still slow - not good when you have a kid!!  Or pets, which I don't have anymore.The number of different shooting modes is definitely good. I like this quite a bit.  Ditto that with the little wheel on the lower right hand side - this wheel is both practical and easy to use.  I like how the menu comes up when you touch it softly to show you what it does.  I also like how it allows you to scroll quickly through pictures on the review mode.I'm torn overall how I really feel about the camera.  Unfortunately, it seems to be my experience that you need to get 500-1000 pictures before you really have a feel for a camera, and of course, by then, who's going to take it back??  So, we'll see.ps - Maybe mine has a different function or extra mode b/c it's brand new, but the zoom can go up to 56x, and when used properly (ie - on a tripod or other stabilizer), it takes EXCELLENT long distance shots.pps - I have this set up to notify me when you write comments on my reviews.  If you have any hints, suggestions, or can help me with something I'm doing wrong (particularly the up close zoom issue I'm having), please comment so that I can get some help!  Want to love this camera...!

Reviews.Title: small but terrible
Reviews.Author: jjr
Reviews.Content: yes this an excellent p&s; digital camera. i love this camera beacuse i learned a lot from this. it influenced me to buy a dslr/slt camera(i bought sony a55). it gave me an idea what dslr is. i bought this because for its zoom capability. 14x zoom extended up to 56x and its image quality. the reason i rated this a four star is because of it's low light capability. the camera can get confused in an artificial lights. i use flash when it happen, so its not a big deal for me. the build quality is very good. dslr has a better image quality but it will not always with you unlike this camera you can bring this anytime and every where you want to go. i like the fish-eye mode too. there is a lot of future of this camera that is fun to use...you can use this in a fast action too...i brought this in a concert and it did a good job. i took i videos and photos at about 100 meters away from us. even at night it performed well. i really appreciated those good reviewers that help me to buy this camera and my new slt a55. thank you to all of you..

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Frog 2
Reviews.Content: Service was great.My husband has a camera like this and I wanted one for me.  It is a great camera. Zooms like a larger format camera.  The camera is like new. I don't think the previous owner even used it!I would use this company again.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 14x Wide Angle Optical
Reviews.Author: sonya
Reviews.Content: The product is good but seems to not exceed expectation but under low lights this is ok but overall a good one.

Reviews.Title: Received Used
Reviews.Author: Duzgun Aral
Reviews.Content: I just received the camera. The camera itself is great because we bought one for my sister from a retail store. I wanted to buy one for myself too. I ordered one which just arrived but the camera has fingerprints all over its screen at feels like as if it is used. I am going return it.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX210 IS
Reviews.Author: PC Oakview
Reviews.Content: It is a fairly compact camera that packs a 14X optical zoom lens with image stabilization. A wide LCD display is good for review and play back recording movie. It is very easy to use because simple button.Both the picture and movie quality are good. You could take good pictures in low light condition. You could also adjust the zoom when recording movie. I like to set the dial to `Auto Mode' as I can take picture by pressing the shutter button or record movie by press the movie button. I could still take pictures while recording movie. It is a good choice for traveling if you do not demand too much in photographing.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX210IS
Reviews.Author: C. St Clair
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera right before Christmas.  I'm still learning to use all the features.  So far, I have been pleased with the pictures.  I tried the video indoors and the quality was good; however, there appears to be some focus blurr during shooting. Still haven't used the camera outdoors yet.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: TOMMY NG
Reviews.Content: Overall it's a good camera with a lot of feature.  As a Canon product, it provide good quality of picture.  So far I don't have any complain.

Reviews.Title: Flash in bad place, telephoto focus not best
Reviews.Author: Above Rubies Mom "Trish"
Reviews.Content: We got this camera specifically for taking pics for stop motion animation, not everyone would have the same problems we did. My two biggest issues were the flash location as my hand would get in the way of it automatically popping up & then the screen would instruct me to manually raise flash which I could not figure out how to do (did not check instruction book as wasn't worth my time since it was going to be an ongoing problem I did not want to deal with)& when I tried using telephoto to close in on small Lego it would not focus well. If the camera was placed directly in front of object with no telephoto the macro mode turned on automatically and took a good quality picture. This is probably a great camera for people who want to use a point & shoot for outdoor use, but it didn't meet our unusual needs.I did not give it a 3 because it wasn't fair to grade it on a purpose that is outside its intended use. People who want to take pics of their kids or outside will probably find it very suited to that purpose.Our $95 older model Canon takes better pics for our purpose so wasn't worth keeping. Returns to Amazon are always awesome & easy. Square Trade warranties can also easily be canceled & refunded, both are great companies that I'm thankful to do business with & I almost never buy retail thanks to Amazon's excellent business practices.PROS-Picture quality was great-Screen was large & very good display-Macro focus on no telephoto was very good.-Great screen info when shooting modes are switched and easy to read without glasses for this over 40 yr old.CONS-Flash is very poorly located, makes it difficult to hold.-Did not focus well using telephoto for indoor use on inanimate objects.-Somewhat "heavy" for body shape so not as easy to hold. I was concerned it would get dropped.

Reviews.Title: Small package performance
Reviews.Author: MAISO "maiso40"
Reviews.Content: In my search for portability, I choose this camera over the Nikon coolpix 8100.To me, the canon sx210 edged the nikon just because the manual shooting mode.I own a DSLR and 2 prosumer camcorders, I also still own the canon S80 point and shoot, wich is an old model and I wanted an update in canon technology with the sx210. Recently I took this camera on a cruise ship, ( left my DSLR at home,did not want to hang a big chunk of camera on my neck) and this camera helped me do a pretty good job documenting my vacations with pics and videos. First of all I hated the zoom lever right away, is too small and flimsy it takes some use to it, the whole build of the camera feels flimsy, is plastic and very light in weight you have to be very delicate in the handling of this camera. The S80 feels more like a camera in every aspect.In the photo side of the house, color acrracy, exposure, metering, focus speed I found it exellent. The image stabilization works well with the large zoom, of course the more stable your the better your long distance shots are gonna come out.I found myself using the presets when I didn't have time to tweak, it worked out fine and i never lost the spur of the moment in any shots. In treaky situations manual mode is the way to go, if you use a DSLR before you'll feel right at home with this camera's manual mode. Also anybody with no experience with cameras can shoot very good pics in auto or easy modes in most shooting enviroments. The flash also works fine and you can increase or decrease the intensity, combine that with manual ISO, aperture and shutter speed and you will have perfect pics all the time.In the video side of the house. In broad daylight you will get a beautiful 720p High def video (mov file format) but guess what; in low light is a different story, the camera manages to mantain color acurracy and brightness but the noise plague is inevitable. In mid to low light the white balance is a little slow adjusting, but of course you have white balance presets to overcome that. Also in low light the focus starts hunting(all cameras do in low light)and some time is really hard to get it back, so I quickly switch to manual focus, avoid zooming and ohh! what a difference that made. That's a general rule to shoot in low light for any camera not just the canon sx210, you have to know your camera well to get the best out of it.I wanted portability and a little better quality of pics and vids than a smartphone. My overall experience with this camera has been very good so far. I did not expected DSLR nor prosumer camcorder performance but this camera can mimic such feats in a small tiny package.

Reviews.Title: I had to return it....
Reviews.Author: K. Robertson "Out in the Burbs"
Reviews.Content: ...because the shutter lag in taking a photo drove me crazy.  I'm hoping some of my dissatisfaction with this camera was because I didn't use it enough, but the issues I had were:  shutter lag, location of the flash (every time it  tried to open, that was exactly where my finger was, and I didn't know how to get it to reopen without turning off the camera and starting over), and as a personal note, I didn't like the feel of it in my hands.  My guess is, should I have kept it longer, I would have enjoyed it much more.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: TeriG
Reviews.Content: I read the other good reviews on this camera so I thought it was going to be great. I was really surprised at the quality of the pics-very poor for the price. My Sony camera which was 90$ took better pics. I quickly returned this camera!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Indoor Pictures with or without flash
Reviews.Author: K. Ho
Reviews.Content: I've had Canons since my old film-based SLRs and know them well.  When I moved to digital I relied on my old IS series cameras, but recent models have proven counter-intuitive and hard to adjust to capture low-light indoor shots, which we're all after given the flood of documentary/realty tv shows that light seemingly ordinary people so well.  Canons struggled to do that in the past.  But with this sleek, well-priced entry Canon allows you to adjust most relevant settings of F-stops and 'shutter' times, but also it's flash and intuitive programming make most indoor pictures warm, luminous and inviting where only SLRs dared tread before.It's worth it too as the user interface is smarter and easier to read, the LCD screen is huge and, what I find both Orwellian and joker like (but love it regardless) is the camera's 'smart mode' that will automatically take a picture of anyone smiling in its field of vision.  =)

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: V. Sena "Valerie"
Reviews.Content: I had a sony DSW55 for about 2 years, did the job really well, but lately was getting all blurry, so I decided to do some research before getting a new one. Since I cannot afford a DSLR at the moment I chose this one, and I love it. The only down side I would say that it is the position of the flash and sometimes the auto mode doesn't do what it is supposed to do. But if you actually take your time and try to learn about its features I am sure you are not going to be disappointed. It is a excellent camera.

Reviews.Title: Could a compact digital camera get any better?
Reviews.Author: Sophia N
Reviews.Content: Amazing digital camera-love the 720p hd, big screen & great flash & also the 14x zoom is very helpful. Take it with me everywhere I go , great size & doesn't weigh much--love all of the features that are programed in the camera like the colour accent & fish eye lense. Highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: Compartment hard to open!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Many of the features, as noted in the other reviews, work well, However, the compartment holding the battery and memory card is very difficult to open.  The "latch" is so small that it's hard to push and slide to open the compartment.  Very frustrating.If you get the gold color camera, as I did, you may find that the icons on the mode selection button are hard to read.  The white icon against the gold does not have enough contrast to be easily readable under various conditions.  Wish I'd gotten a darker color.The other issue I have with this camera is that a remote control is not available.  So, if you're connecting the camera directly to a TV you have no way to fast forward, reverse, etc.  There should be a remote available, at least as an accessory.

Reviews.Title: Dust on lens cannot be removed
Reviews.Author: ptwise
Reviews.Content: After just a year, my Canon Powershot SX210 IS is useless.  First only one dust particle appeared - it was inside the camera so no amount of lens care would rectify the problem.  I compensated by using retouch using Picasa.  That worked only for a time and then many blotches appeared - again inside the lens.  I have tried to figure out how to fix this but have yet to find a solution.For the "top end" of the Canon line - this is unacceptable.  I do not recommend buying from Canon until they come up with a solution.If there were an automobile, there would be a recall.

Reviews.Title: Waste of Money
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 14x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD - BlackI have regretted buying this camera.  The pictures are not sharp and clear.  I wanted a camera that would be simple to use.  My husband has used a Canon AE1 for years and took excellent photos.  I knew this camera wouldn't take the same quality pictures that he takes but thought they would be better than what they are.  This camera is a total waste of money.  I am in the market to find a camera and it will not be a Canon this time.

Reviews.Title: Dust and Lint inside lens ruin your photos
Reviews.Author: Martin Leiderman
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 14x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Gold)Do not buy this camera. Lint and dust get inside the lens from the first day. There is no way to access and clean it.

Reviews.Title: Dust problems inside the lens
Reviews.Author: prbonill
Reviews.Content: The lens are not dust proof. After a few months of normal use (no beach), dust gets inside the camera lens, being impossible to clean them up, unless you send the camera for service.

Reviews.Title: Good features
Reviews.Author: severnet
Reviews.Content: It's a good camera... Canon give the confidence of a images with good quality.The battery is a warranty of more duration than the previous modelsThe only con is the difficulty to get a best poor-light photo.

Reviews.Title: So happy!!
Reviews.Author: Teresa Perkins
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera.  I recommend it for families.  It takes great pictures of kids and the zoom is awesome.  Allows you not to bother them but still take your precious pictures.  The night pics are average, but still very much worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Good point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Glen
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera for about a month, it replaces an Olympus SP-350. I liked the Oly with the exception of long shutter lag in low light conditions and still use it for work photos.The image quality from the Canon are good but not quite a good as the Oly especially in low light conditions where they get a little grainy when enlarged. However, the shutter lag is much better and the focusing is much faster. The flash is a little weak.The menu system is a little confusing with modes and settings buried in the menu system rather than available from the dial. It will take some time to get used to. The manual is very brief and the supplied software is cumbersome in viewing and archiving photos.I haven't tried the manual settings to date; I'm still not comfortable with the menu system. In automatic mode my pictures have been good in all conditions from bright sunlight to dusk. The metering system and autofocus work well. I love the 14x zoom and the stabilization works well at full zoom.The video is suprisingly good although the sound is a little weak.Overall I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Features are lots of fun. Took on cruise and took great pics. Still learning how to use all the features!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX210IS
Reviews.Author: A. Proctor
Reviews.Content: Nice camera but with several somewhat annoying features: 1. Automatic pop-up Flash placed inconveniently where one naturally holds camera. 2. On-off button small and difficult to press. Image quality good, user-friendly settings and prompts.

Reviews.Title: Meager!
Reviews.Author: christie colla
Reviews.Content: I own many digital cameras, and I wanted this one for its high megapixels and long zoom.Well, the camera is way below what I'd expected... It doesn't make good close up shots, in low light it is grainy and it is slow.I had a bad feeling when I started working with it, I wish I'd sent it back...

Reviews.Title: truecolor
Reviews.Author: Federico Joelani
Reviews.Content: I have owned and operated the Canon SX 210 IS for approx a year.  Have noted marked inaccurate color distortions when shooting inside in AUTO or EASY mode...which must be corrected by manually adjusting white balance, light metering, etc.to achieve anything close to accurate colors...but takes time and often miss the photo op.The same thing often occurs outside, in natural light, with neutral objects (like straw hats, clouds, etc.) taking on an unnatural yellow color...even skin colors often take on the colors of the surrounding objects.  Very frustrating...something expected from a much less expensive camera...this problem with untrue color reproduction is beneath the acceptable quality of a good camera...this is not a good point and shoot camera...photographer must constantly work to correct color distortions manually.One wonders if Canon did any quality control testing with the SX 210 IS ??

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointing...
Reviews.Author: Aubrey
Reviews.Content: I'm a scrapbooker and have used digital cameras for years. After hours of research, I bought the Powershot, ready to take pictures of Halloween, my daughter in her first play, and 2 of my kids' birthday parties.  What a disappointment! Pictures in regular light were blurry, color was off when I downloaded them, the flash many times wouldn't go off when it was needed (yet the flash was up), pictures in low light were awful, and anything that moved (i.e. MY KIDS!) turned out really blurry. All these pictures were taken in the Auto or Easy mode (two different modes)... My camera that's 5+ years old did a lot better than this one. If I can't get good pics. in Auto/Easy mode, it's not worth it to me. I'm a mom of 3 and don't have the time to set up every little picture. I'm returning it and am highly considering a Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Fits in my front pants pocket
Reviews.Author: Silent Running
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about the size of this camera because I love having a camera that I can keep in my front pants pocket. However, I couldn't find a review anywhere that addressed this concern directly. So, I'm writing one.If you are an average sized adult male who wears Dockers or blue jeans with loose pockets, you should have no problem fitting this camera into your front pants pocket.Sorry, ladies and children-- you'll to wait for one of your own to comment. Guys-- hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX210IS
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: We can happy with both product and the service. All the items I've purchased had received on or before the date mentioned. I purchased the camera when I was in USA. But now I'm living in Sri Lanka, means I might have a problem with the warranty. But so far it is working properly. Hope I can contact the local agent if needed or send it back to USA.Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 14x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: not satisfied
Reviews.Author: Alpay Akyol
Reviews.Content: camera does not take sharp and clear pictures.every picture is blur which i hate of kind of images.

Reviews.Title: Its Sweet when the Price Is Right
Reviews.Author: AreThoseSpots?
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at $199.00 on an Amazon Daily Deal. But after receiving mine, I am seeing 3 spots in or below the lens glass that won't clean off and that is not good.It means that the dirt was in there in the factory, caught between the outer lens and the inner lens in the focal area. I am feeling that these units were offered as a deal for that reason and not mentioned to the purchaser. Cannon "Must" have quality control and this is a major inspection point.  Now I have to return mine and get another one.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for those who are active
Reviews.Author: T. CANO
Reviews.Content: Got this item on sale - great camera - works well, sturdy design - zoom works great, this camera is well suited to the active lifestyle.

Reviews.Title: not happy with camera overall
Reviews.Author: grandmas "grandmas"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift to replace my 4 mp Olympus.  I took many pictures indoors and out zoomed and not using my old and new camera side by side. I'm sure if I had to blow up the pics a lot, I would see a difference.  Since I don't do that, I just judged the pics as they were and my old Olympus far outperformed the new Canon. I didn't like the way the flash was located right where you put your left hand when holding the camera.  I also couldn't turn the flash off when I tried.  I thought the worst part of the camera was a lot of pics blurred.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Dharam Botadra
Reviews.Content: Pros: good image quality,lots of features in such compact camera,Overall awesome..!!cons: when the lens retracts inside it produces some sound.

Reviews.Title: Can't recommend it even if I liked it because of bad quality control
Reviews.Author: Gerardo Pedraza
Reviews.Content: While the camera's features are good for the price, I have sent this camera back twice.  The first one had a dead pixel on the LCD screen after a week of use.  Then I got a new one, thanks to Amazon's great service.  The second one worked fine until it had the same problem 3 months later.  The problem is that this time the pixel appears like a red spot when playing the videos on the computer.  So this time I think is something on the sensor.  I think this is going to be my last Cannon even if I love my 30D.  I'll give Nikon a try.I sent the camera to Amazon just after the three months period, hopefully they'll give me store credit or something similar so I can buy the Nikon.Well, that is why I can't recommend the camera even if I liked it's features and performance.  I have been searching the web and I found 3 other people with the same problem, and one of them had the same problem 3 times, so I guess Canon's quality control is not that good on this camera. Now I'm stuck with 2 extra batteries :(Thanks for viewing my review.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: coleyp2c1
Reviews.Content: This camera is great!!  I purchased it because I had a Canon that I dropped and broke.  This was an upgrade from my previous canon and I am nothing but pleased!!

Reviews.Title: Poor performer
Reviews.Author: youthful_utahn
Reviews.Content: This is a nice looking camera with a large feature set. However, the pictures that it took were awful. Especially in low light. I only had this camera for about two weeks before returning it. Side-to-side comparisons of auto-mode with my old 3 Mpixel Nikon E3100 were very interesting. The colors were much worse every time with this camera, the pictures were always overexposed, and this camera always seemed to choose an unnecessarily slow shutter speed resulting in blurring of the picture.

Reviews.Title: Not good pictures in low light
Reviews.Author: Vimal Sharma "VS"
Reviews.Content: Takes too much time to transfer image to the memory chip on the camera. low light pictures are not good.

Reviews.Title: Major design flaw - pop up flash
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I wanted so badly to like this camera... I tried and tried, but there was no way I could get accustomed to the pop up flash.  The major problem is the placement of the flash.  It's exactly where you put your finger or thumb to hold the camera.  No matter how many times I tried to remember to hold it differently, I just couldn't.  You turn on the power and there it is...right under your index finger, trying to pop-up but it can't because your finger is there.Sure, you can manually pull the flash up from its hiding place if you need it, but that's a hassle, especially because the flash doesn't always know that its supposed to be powered on now that it's in the up position.This is just a bad design, period.  I read a lot here before buying and the major complaint seemed to be that the flash casts a shadow in the picture, but I only noticed that a few times.  Really, the bigger problem is that this thing is just not ergonomically designed.The extra wide angle was great as well as the super zoom, and those are the major reasons I bought this unit, but in the end, I just couldn't live with the flash trying to open up under my finger every time I turned it on.Manual features were great, ability to control the output of the flash was nice for indoor portraits, macro feature seemed to work well, too.Back to the drawing board with this one Canon.

Reviews.Title: Some redeeming qualities but overall hated the outcome
Reviews.Author: Andrea L
Reviews.Content: I hate to say such a highly respected name as Canon would put out something this unsatisfactory.  Some attributes were awesome as in night photography or even photos taken in a dark room (lighting turned out as if in day or lights in SOME photos came out beautifully while preserving the darkness surrounding BUT sometimes even the next photo of the same thing would appear to be a time lapse image with an awful result) I took this on a trip and took lots of photos using auto or easy mode which didn't help and I'd have to say 80% of photos taken were blurry or completely out of focus.  When reviewing them I was sickened as I can never take those photos again.  Returned it no questions asked so customer service is exceptional but man, this camera sucked.  The images that did come out were stellar but it's not an outcome you can consistently expect.  And forget motion, this camera can't handle action shots.  Videos were jumpy at best, they would pause continually on camera review and on computer.  I am so completely disappointed.  Oh, and the camera, after taking a photo (which does have a delay at time of shooting) would give a "busy" symbol and message for quite a time so don't expect fast photography at all.  If you have to wait for each image to process you're going to miss that next shot you really wanted as I did on many occasions.  Sorry to say (and I am P.O.S.T. certified in forensic photography) that this camera was a complete waste of my time.

Reviews.Title: bad news camera x 2
Reviews.Author: james
Reviews.Content: ORDERED THIS CAMERA  BASED ON POSITIVE REVIEWS  THE FIRST ONE WAS REALLY BAD IT WAS UNABLE TO MAINTAIN A CLEAR FOCUS  HOPED IT WAS A FLUKE (or lemon)  RETURNED IT AND REORDERED  THE SECOND ONE IS MARGINALLY BETTER  BUT FOCUS IS NOT REALLY CLEAR AND IS INCONSISTENT  IN QUALITY  SOME FAIR PICS  MANY POOR PICS  AM RETURNING IT ALSO  NEVER HAD PROBLEMS WITH CANNONS BEFORE  WHATS  UP ????

Reviews.Title: Will not work with Windows 7 !!
Reviews.Author: Luis E. Didiez
Reviews.Content: This camera will not work with Windows 7 !!And neither Canon or Microsoft have a solution; this can be verified by the many cases reported through internet [look it up with Google].DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT IF EXPECTED TO SYNC WITH WINDOWS 7.Would have rated 0 star, but sadly not possible.

Reviews.Title: Takes a bit of re-learning not the Canon of yesteryear
Reviews.Author: E. Bacon
Reviews.Content: Pictures Quality:  As with all Canon Cameras, the picture quality is decent.  I had the original ELPH, then the 630, then the SX200IS, and now the SX210.Exterior: Love the smaller form factor of the SX210 over the SX200IS.  I still have issues with that POP-UP flash, my fat finger kept getting in the way because that's where my left hand lands when I turn on the camera.Controls: Look at my title.  Canon has shuffled around a little the controls, I'm sure I'll learn the new "features" and controls soon enough.  Right now, the frustration is with taking video, I thought I was recording, but realize afterwards that the RECORD button wasn't on.  I missed out on a great shot of the SHUTTLE ATLANTIS going up!Will edit as I learn more about this new camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Constance Breedlove "Connie"
Reviews.Content: I expected this camera to give crystal clear pictures.  In truth, my 10 year old Olympus takes a better quality picture!  Also, the flash mechanism was right under where I normally hold the camera, so it wouldn't automatically raise and had to be done manually most of the time.  Loved the color, which is why I considered the camera in the first place (dumb reason!), but expected it to be state-of-the-art quality after reading the write-ups as well.  I returned the camera and received a refund (this portion of the transaction was perfect).

Reviews.Title: Question on Memory Card
Reviews.Author: Chucky "Chucky"
Reviews.Content: I just ordered this camera and waiting for it to arrive. My question is: what memory card would you recommend for this model? I'm going on a week-long trip soon and intend to take a million pictures (and some video shots). I want to make sure I get enough cards to last the trip. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: too many problems
Reviews.Author: pbmts999
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera.  Takes nice pics and movies and is easy to use.  However, what good is a camera if you cannot download your pics and movies to your PC without having to be a computer guru. I am running windows xp on a dell with plenty of ram and disk space. I googled the error message I received when I tried to do my first download and came up with dozens of hits.  This is a common problem for all cannon digital camera's.  On cannons web site they have a "knowledge base" for problem solutions.  Among my choices were:  reboot; reinstall cannons software; reinstall windows; upgrade to a newer version of windows; download windows service packs;  etc etc etc....  It is either my fault or my computers fault but cannon takes no responsibility.  I also sent an email to cannon describing my problem in detail and the only response I received was an email stating that they had received my email.  before you buy a cannon google your model number and look for problem/complaints.

Reviews.Title: Short Changed
Reviews.Author: Robert B. Roche
Reviews.Content: I was suppose to receive a 4GB SDHC Memory Card free with the purchase of this camera. I never received it nor have I ever heard anything from Amazon regarding it. When purchasing an item worth this kind of money one would think that Amazon would live up to their end of the bargin. Will think twice before coming back to them.

Reviews.Title: RETURNED ASAP
Reviews.Author: Lefty Lucy
Reviews.Content: This camera is NOT like Canon wants you to believe.  It touts the review about the guy that's a professional photographer and can use this camera in place of his SLR or video camera. Do not fall because of these kinds of reviews, this camera dose not come close to ANY modern SLR or HD video camera.  Compared to my other Canon cameras (G9 and VIXIA HV30) this camera has a very cheep lens and 14 mega pixels dose not help a crappy lens. You get what you pay for, not what these 5 star reviews say, so beware.

Reviews.Title: Color of camera
Reviews.Author: Prickly Pear
Reviews.Content: I was in a "purple" mood when I ordered this camera.  Otherwise, I would have gone with the more conservative gold color.  Quite disappointed that the camera looks closer in color to my "red" netbook (I would call it burgundy) than the true purple shown on my computer screen.  It's more violet (reddish) than purple. In fact, I thought maybe I got a "red" one by mistake, but that was another camera that came in red. Not all that important, I know; just one of the downsides to ordering online. Writing this so anyone else out there who is influenced by colors will be aware.Before I used the camera, I knew I had a good one because my stepson and son-in-law went ga-ga over it. Now that I've used it, two of my favorite things about it are the telephoto capacity and the fact that I can take pictures without a flash in low light conditions and get a good picture where other cameras couldn't get one even with a flash. It's awesome!!Took me a while to learn -- and still learning -- how to set all the features because I don't like spending time to put a CD in the computer or going to an online manual to search for specific instructions. It's easier to thumb through a paper manual and mark it for quick reference next time.  But I have to say, never having had a Canon before, it's pretty user friendly.  It did take me 3 months, though, to figure out that when you press on the edges of the round dial you get four different menus depending on which side, top, or bottom was pressed.  I kept getting one of the menus, but didn't know how I did it and didn't know how to make it stay there long enough to choose. Even the aforementioned camera nerds couldn't tell me. But then I accidentally pressed a different side and figured it out. :)
